text: First Burrito Sushi I ever ate.   Has to be in the top 5 Sushi items I have eaten. Phenomenal taste and fresh. I live in the other side of the state but I will be back to devour many more sushi burritos in the future.

Love this place, just love it!  Ok it takes a little orientation but can't wait to come back!  The front of the house process is a little confusing to newcomers.  We figured it out . . . after that WOW.  The wine, food, and atmosphere AMAZING!!!  Just go see for yourself.  This is a wine bar experience unrivaled.  Helpful staff too.  Cool place!!!

Went during busy time and it was an awful experience... Waitress didn't know the menu.. Meal came out in sections so by the time everything i ordered came out 1/2 the meal was cold.... Bacon was uncooked... Won't be back again unless i come very early
Seriously tho, why change the noodles from beef noodle soup to some cheap non chewy dry noodles!!??

I had the wings(buffalo) and they were great! Love the Fries as well. I even received a potato with a smiley face! I will be returning to try the burgers soon!

The inside is a little small, but until the concept is proven I would keep it that way. Friendly staff!

I am just updating this review, it took a lot longer than expected to hear back from someone at The Grove Hotel but we received many apologies and they are doing everything to make it right, it's not our wedding night but they have done above and beyond to show that they absolutely are sincere and they did what they could. We appreciate it more than ever and hope that we we get to use our free stay, we can actually enjoy it. Thank you Grove Hotel!
Filipino breakfast was delish! Owner Loida was awesome & super friendly! My family & I will definitely come back!
The best smoked kielbasa around.  Nice little place in a nice side street also check out the perogies or homemade perfect.

I had high hopes for this place but coming from a southern family I've been spoiled. The chicken tenders were dry, the mac & cheese was good, the herb beef was excellent, the cauliflower side was good, the green bean casserole was OK, and the cornbread was just OK. Positive: extremely fast service!

Listen. If Kekes up the street can handle a massive line out the door and Still have great service and food delivery at the perfect time, the Village INN can also get it together and provide the same service. They need better management even though we did get the bill paid for by her, we weren't looking for a hand out we were looking for great tasting food as well as a taste of their pies which they claim to be known for. Again, with a change of menu, cooks, and management, this place and totally be eclectic, fun and interesting. There was a server we saw that was Awesome ! She was on point and organized we wished we did have her but instead we ended up with a young lady who really didn't want to work today. I get it but you are working in a industry that is brutal and your customer service and organizational skills is important.

Burger restaurant in the hotel. Good burgers but you have a choice of single or double ( 1/3 lb) patty's. Two sounded like too much sine a half pounder is all I would want to eat. However the single was too small for a hungry person so get the double. Not as large after cooking. I ordered s bourbon and was asked if I wanted a single or double!! Switched the order to a bottle of wine when I heard that. I'm not a fan of measured pours at a bar.

Stopped in for lunch. This was my 2nd visit. I got a spinach and feta croissant which was yummy. There are several different things to choose from and the prices can't be beat. Last time, I had the spicy shrimp Nolache which is like a bun with spicy shrimp inside. It was yummy too. There are a lot of drinks on the menu but since I'm not really into coffee and tea I didn't order anything to drink. 

The food is fresh and so affordable that you can get a couple of different things if you want. 

Parking can be a challenge, there are a handful of spaces in front of Chef but I'm not sure if there are others on the other sides of the building. 

There were several people sitting working on their laptops so the atmosphere must stay fairly calm and I imagine there is free wifi. 

I'll be back to try something else soon.
Amazing hospital, amazing staff, beautiful facilities, I can't say enough wonderful things about this hospital. Best in the area for children's care. Highly recommended!
AMAZING........we ordered the xl quesadilla and an assortment of tacos. Best Mexican food we have found in Tampa. Reminds us of the Mexican food tents in south Tucson AZ. We will be back!!!

After weeks (months) of putting off the chore of getting my car cleaned (hard to admit that it was totally due to my laziness), I was referred by a friend to try out 2u Car Shine, and couldn't believe how satisfied I was. Honestly, I wasn't really too sure what to expect, but my baby desperately needed a little TLC. 

I contacted 2u Car Shine, and conveniently set up a time for someone to come out. Dave arrived and I was actually very impressed with the work he did on my car. The best part is, I was able to knock off 3 of my to-do's while the service was being performed (4 including getting my car cleaned!). 

I'm not much for posting reviews online, but this was a service that I really thought deserved it! I will 100% be recommending 2u Car Shine to others, and will definitely be a returning customer. 

A+ for convenience
A+ for service
A+ for quality of work
A+ for me for being able to complete my chores!

The pho beef was very monotone, and everything in it was very beefy even the noodles.once you added sauce to the soup it tasted good. And then the noodle gained all of the sauce flavors. The beef was really Dry wasn't that great the soup was bland the spring rools had an overwhelming amount of lettuce, with no meats, or herbs. With the soups they did not give us the plate of herbs Ether. They had a lot of thing other then pho, and there lunch special did not even include pho

My first time and what an amazing treat. The empanadas were amazing and I ordered the pork tenderloin which was cooked to perfection. I also had the carriage house margarita which was yummy. Everything was wonderful including our very helpful and knowledgeable server Miriam! I will definitely be back

I am a really big fan of this place.

Their food is pretty good and the beer is great.

I love the atmosphere. Its a great place to watch a game or just relax with a flight and play shuffleboard. 

Barrio is a must try on the Tucson beer circuit.

I've lived at the Summit for two years now, I resigned hoping after the management changed things would get better, but of course they didn't. It's really close to campus, but there's no parking at night, traffic is really bad, and it is extremely overpriced. The apartments look nice at a glance but were built very badly and have a lot of technical issues like leaks and broken appliances. If you want a quiet place to live, this is not the place to be, students are constantly partying, running around yelling, throwing up everywhere, and setting off the entire building's fire alarms. The alarms go one for at least a half an hour and a lot of times its really late at night, the alarm is actually going off right now and that why I'm writing this review. Where every you decided to live, DO NOT choose the Summit, it might look pretty with pool, hot tub, and granite counter tops, but you'll regret it. I would just find a house near by for rent or if you really want to go with a student apartment go with the Highlands, its older and kinda beat up, but it is run a lot better and is a better place to live overall from what I've seen.

A great long time Sparks institution that has a different daily special on most days. All you can eat taco Tuesday and $2 pints on Wednesday to name a couple. It takes a lot to get 5 stars from me, I'm kind of stingy with them, but 4 stars is an easy score here. Food is always good and fresh, drinks are stiff and staff is always nice. Parking can be an issue if it gets busy, but only if you expect front row. There is plenty to be had, you just have to walk a bit. Live bands on some weekends with a decent stage setup and dance space. Whitney Meyer started out here on the staff and on the stage. (Google her, she was a contestant on The Voice)

I was in Philadelphia for my cousin's wedding and needed a room the night, I booked a room at a decent price and enjoyed my stay at The Windsor Suites. The staff was kind and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Check-in and out was a breeze. I would recommend and stay here again if I was in the area!

Great selection!  I went for the Ashton Monarch and the Padron Anniversario 1964 to go with my 2 espresso martinis served in the upstairs lounge.  What a treat!  This is an example of a well run cigar lounge.
Really enjoyed our visit here last weekend. The veggie burger sandwich and fries were just scrumptious!! And the hubs loved the beer flights! Awesome restaurant in a great location!

This is a great local bar that has many different drink specials  (listed on the website newtavernbar.com ).

They have DJ nights, karaoke night, open mike night and they also have a second room up from the bar.

They are very friendly!  And can hold birthday parties and give you a free cake.

I'm picky about my flowers and it's hard to trust a florist a few thousand miles away. Well, I did in this case and was really glad I did.  She sent me a picture of the flowers and they were beautiful and you could see that they were very fresh and they even followed the directions I gave. The woman I sent them too said they were the prettiest flowers she has ever gotten. Thank you so much for your service and the great price!!!

The worst customer service I've experienced in a retail grocery store of this magnitude. The products they sell are superior, but expect to be treated like garbage.  I've been here several times able today sent me over.  No manager to speak to, leave feedback on their page and get an absolutely rude response, which I did a screenshot of and will be sharing!
Today was order was terrible, got hot dry pepper chicken.   Missing chicken, all flour (see pic below).  We will not be coming back, instead to Zwei.
Amazing sushi here. Definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a great place to eat

Went for the first time on a recent Friday evening. I was a little surprised that it wasn't very busy. The food and service were great and it was a very good dinner. I had the DLT Sandwich and it was delicious. I ordered a Manhattan to drink which was good too. I'd say the prices might be a bit high but honestly it was a high quality place so no complaints.

WiFi is terrible! Coffee is average. We got the vegan wrap and it was really dry and bland. So sad because it looked good. But just no flavor and not nearly enough sauce. The texture was hard to swallow because of how dry it was.

I wandered in here today with my boyfriend bc a silver shirt caught my eye from the street. The ladies working were so awesome. Friendly, helpful, and not annoying or pushy. The woman had to help me dress and clip the shirt on. She was very professional and it was a wonderful shopping experience. The store itself has so many great unique things. I wanted to buy it all. Don't miss this neat little shop. Also--- the prices are very reasonable. Nothing like some of the other boutiques. You could very easily get a one of a kind outfit with accessories for less than $100, maybe even less than $75. I love this store
Best Indian restaurant in Pinellas County. Unfortunately too far for me to visit as much as I want!! delicious

I have been here a few times and it has been great every time. Great dogs and the itialian beef sandwich is a must also. You are always treated like an old friend when you come there. The Chicago dog is great, you get the Snap from the hot dog like it should be.  I had the slaw dog the other day and had to get extra slaw to take home. Tell him captain Ron sent you.

I enjoyed a good dinner here. It is a small restaurant, but has a nice selection of Peruvian dishes. I had an excellent Chicken Causa for an appetizer followed by Palta a la Reinga salad. My Lomo Saltado was well seasoned, but the beef was tough and a little over cooked.   They also had Cusqueña and Crystal Peruvian beers. 

For a Friday night, the place was pretty quiet. Given my love of Peruvian food, it is a sure bet I will be back.
Amazing! Michael was a great tour guide and quite scary stories. Would recommend all day!
Completely Americanized,  food had no flavor.  Was barely a 2 star at best. Last time we come here!

The dude has a passion for food and meats. It shows in the selections he has available for purchase and the food, both made in house. I've only been there once (so far) and got the pulled pork sandwich. The pickles, meat and bread come together so well, you'll find yourself helplessly licking your fingers between bites. Personally, I can't wait to sample the rest of his foods. Get in there and do the same!

Came here for breakfast + drinks based on Yelp! Reviews. I love that there's plenty of parking in front and in the back for free. Woo! There's plenty of seating inside which is refreshing and their staff is quick to greet customers. 

We ordered a cap, a tea latte and two breakfast options. My tea latte was delicious and I'd definitely recommend it. Sean's cappuccino had latte art which we loved, but it tasted like a wet latte, and lacked micro foam outside of a very thin layer on top. 

If you're picky about your cappuccino's, keep this in mind, as we ordered and paid for two and both came out the same. A little disappointing but we learned.

Besides that, I can't really recommend the breakfast menu items even though everyone posted photos of them. The breakfast sandwich was super small and didn't have a ton of flavor. The breakfast burrito tasted like day-after leftovers that was in some gravy base. 

In all, if you're looking for a quick place that has easy parking and lots of seating (plus charging stations for the win) this is a great option. But if you're looking to grab breakfast somewhere, I'd suggest coming here for the tea only.

Hits and misses for me. The harvest greens were crisp and fresh and had a tasty dressing, but it was a bit too much, and the blue cheese and candied pecans didn't work terribly well together. The mushroom pot pie filling was wonderfully rich and creamy, with such interesting spices, but the pastry was too tough to cut with my knife and fork. The 7-minute egg was delicious, but the Brussels sprouts were too salty. They have an extensive wine list, though, which surprised me, given it's a beer place. The service was friendly and efficient. It's a bit awkward walking in from the hotel side. There's no hostess station and it feels a bit unfriendly until you catch someone's eye.

Got there to find that you no longer need to put your name down for a table but to seat yourself. So we had a party of 6 squeezed into a booth made for 4. We were gonna accept it since the place was packed and you had to fight for a place to eat here. But then a miracle happened and a larger booth opened up. We already gotten out food but the waitress was really nice and let us move since it was still in her zone. No biggie. But then the service was not up to par. She only bought us one set of silverware. I figured she just put the one down to go and get 5 more. Nope. So we had to ask for plates and more silverware. She brings us the other half of our order and says she'll come back with the plates and silverware. Brings me my drink. By this time we almost done eating. No napkins. Ended up stealing a batch from the bar. No silverware. No plates. Finally she brings plates and silverware. But she only bought 4 silverware sets/napkins and 5 plates. We have a party of 6. You do the math. Then she disappears for the rest of our meal. We don't see her again. We ended up having to hunt her down to ask for our check. Also note that before all this we were almost given someone else's order. The people delivering it totally looked lost. 

This place is still running around with its head cut off. I noticed that there is an entire area in the back that they closed. Then you have people hoarding tables while their brats run around to play games. If they are not actively order a continuous food/drink I think they are done. Maybe give em a hint by giving them the check. Just saying. 

Also, if you parked in the garage they only have pay Stations on the first and 6th Floor. That's makes a whole lotta sense. People can either go down to the first floor pay for parking and then go back upstairs to whatever floor they parked on. That's not enough elevators for all that foot traffic. Or you can pay for parking before leaving the 6th floor where people are lined up to buy cards for the games and the foot traffic from the elevators. So now you adding to the foot traffic as well. Yippie. Have fun.

Best car buying experience we have ever been through.  We had a specific type of truck model in mind and price range that we wanted to stay within and saw a truck on their lot that fit the model.  We decided to stop by to ask about the price and found that it was out of our price range.  Harry Martell was the sales associate assisting us and asked specifically what we wanted and price range.  He said a vehicle matching our specifics had just been traded in and was still in the back.  We test drove the vehicle, loved it and without ANY hassle or annoying haggling that you normally experience at dealerships, Harry had us in our new truck and out the door in no time.  Richard, their finance manager had all of our paperwork ready to go and I have to say it was the easiest transaction we have ever experienced.  We appreciate the honesty, ethics and knowledge these two brought to the table.  We love our truck!  Thanks guys!

This is probably one of my most fav places to go play games back in college.   Tho I'm more an adult now (lol), I still enjoy the arcade.  It has gotten pricier than I remembered.  We no longer get tickets cause everything is now put onto the players card.  The games are newer and it looks great in here. But the food is not something I would come to D&B for.  We were hungry after the game at the superdome and decided to eat here instead of at the stadium.  We ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp and steak pasta for me and ribs/chicken wing combo. Let's dive in. 
The pasta dish was super bland.  I had to add salt to it.  Normally I don't even like to add salt to anything ever.  The pasta was soft. The steak medallions were slightly over cooked and the bacon was tasty.  I love the added spinach with my pasta topped with fried spinach.  I miss the blackened chicken pasta! For dessert, we had the Bookie. 

My husband said his ribs were tough to eat and the buffalo wings were too salty.  It's as if the buffalo wings just came out of the oven.  They use bottled ranch instead of making their own.  The fries were soggy as well.  

The Bookie tower for dessert was ok.  They did break the tower down so we can share.  One brownie/cookie topped with a bluebell vanilla scoop of ice cream. You can tell that they had just microwaved a frozen Bookie.  It was hard to eat after a few mins. 

But our server was sweet and provided excellent service. She checked on us constantly as she walked by. Overall we would come back for the games but not for food.

I am here once every couple months and it is always a hit for the lunch specials. Soup or salad, app and main dish for under $12. Sold.
Very friendly service. You can be in and out in 40 minutes if you know what you want fairly quick. Very nice portions and they will cater to the level of spicy you prefer (1 thru 4 I believe). Go with a 2 if you want some spice, but not enough to distract you from your meal.
My favorite dish currently is the Vegetarian Pad Thai. Tons of colorful veggies and tofu to boot. I'm drooling just thinking about it now. I find the Drunken Noodles to be a bit on the oily side, so I don't typically order this one there, even though I it is one of my go to dishes for thai food. 
They are closed Mondays. Chicken Satay special for app. on Tues. and Thursdays only. BYO as well.

Not bad, but not fab. If you need your food fast, you may want to try another place. Considering airport prices, it makes it hard to say I'm a fan. The roast beef sandwich had a hint of horseradish. It would have been nice have more of a kick. Don't be afraid to ask for more sauce if thats your thing. The gu.y serving was cool dude and had a bit of the pirate vibe going which works well with the theme. I took a long time for the food to arrive. One guy had to pack his food. 
Overall not a bad experience. Very convenient though.

Of all the ears of I've gone there , I finally got a friendly attentive waiter (I wish I could recall his name ). The food is just ok , but my whole family races that they have the best Clam
Chowder anywhere . The drinks are just ok . The bar service is slow . It's always full because the restaurant is all outdoors and have a great view (The Gulf). They have live music on certain nights and the local love it . I only go there if someone's asks me to.
I love the aesthetics and culture of this place. It's very clean and has a warm enviroment. Although,  I was impressed by the culture and presentation the food could do more justice.

I found records I forgot about a long time ago. So wonderful to browse through the LPs and take a trip down memory lane. This is a fantastic store to pick up gifts for friends! I even found a bunch of foreign language LPs and CDs that I had to have.

Their selection of fancy donuts is ridiculous! Their donuts change every day and I love going in and being surprised by the new selection. Their sliders are bomb! Never been as happy or satisfied as when I go to District Donuts!

Best service hands down. I came in on a busy Friday evening needing my flat tire evaluated. They managed to repair the tire and installed it with no charge.  When my car is due for tires I will definitely buy them here!
Awful service- there was no line which should have been the first indication. Took over 15 minutes to make two small tacos. Go to Shake Shack instead.

Clean, well maintained machines and the friendliest attendant who walked me through the process of securing a laundry card (cash or credit card to load your laundry card).  Quick Saturday morning errand as hotel did not have onsite laundry. Very impressed

Unfortunately they don't take reservations.  It was a crazy busy weekend and took about an hour to be seated.
Sat on porch behind bar, they had propane heaters so it was plenty warm despite 15 degree weather.
Service was very attentive and friendly.  Food was great. Shasito peppers were perfect. Cauliflower was good and smoking hot spicy.
Glad we waited.
Like their wings, not too big therefore very flavorful! The price is less competitive though. New location is further east than the old one but much bigger.
Food was just mediocre. Nothing was hot just warm. We are not beer drinkers so probably not a great place if you prefer wine.
Sitting here watching incompetency on an epic level. Showed up for a 2:15 appointment and was first in line, then waiting 2 hours for a online order pick up. The manager was rude, biased, and inept!

The food was great and the menu was pretty simple to read. My boyfriend and I shared the crawfish, clam and shrimp bag with Cajun seasoning. Didn't finish it all it was a lot!! We Went on a Saturday at 5pm and was seated pretty quickly. The place got pretty full a few mins after but the staff was very friendly and attentive. We will go back again for sure!!!

Fun unique atmosphere... Many types of tasty tacos.  Try one chili taco.  
Music is loud, but nobody minds.
Super cool tasting room in the Funk Zone in SB. Staff is friendly, and it's a nice setting with the fireplace and some comfy chairs.

I went here for brunch during my birthday. The service was good and attentive. The food was nothing to rave about. A few of us got the Timpano breakfast, the sausage was good but the eggs were burnt and potatoes not fully cooked. The others who got lunch items made the better choice. Their food came out hot. I would come back here for drinks only. The plus was that if you got the unlimited mimosas there was a bar where you could choose your juices.

Don't get the noodle bowl. It was excessively salty and almost half onions. Also, wasn't even in a bowl #sad
Also, the jerk chicken sandwich was more of a ginger sandwich. Overall, lunch was meh.

The Buffalo wrap is the best!!!! I always call my order in and the waitress got me to try this pink sauce that's like a sweet spicy and it's amazing. I can never remember what it is but she always knows what I want! The staff is amazing and it's a great local place to eat!

We love MOD pizza! Such a simple concept and done perfectly every time. It's the one pizza that our family prefers to eat.  The MOD size is perfect for most people. Add as many toppings you want and it's hard to not be full. Our family of four each gets one and we have it made to our preferred tastes.

This place was OK! We came for a late breakfast & were somewhat disappointed that lunch wasn't an option until later in the afternoon. But, y'know, maybe the kitchen's limited. That's fine. Food was alright, my eggs benedict came out drowning in hollandaise, so if you don't want your english muffin to be completely soggy, maybe ask for lighter sauce. My partner had the full english breakfast, which he says was fine. Neither were particularly worth the price. The decor was very cute, the staff kind if a bit stressed. All in all, I don't think I'd come again until I had run out of nearby options.

Nice place. They have indoor and outdoor covered seating. If you have a large party (4+) then outdoor would be your only option. As another reviewer mentioned, you order at the counter and then must get all of your own silverware, straws, and sauces from a side table. No big deal, but some might find it annoying if they did not already know this. Food was good. People were nice. Atmosphere is great. My only issue (hence the 4 stars) is that the portion sizes were kinda small. Maybe it was just what I ordered, but I'm the end I was still hungry. Anyway, I will definitely be back. Gonna try their wings next time.

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday evening.  Made a reservation and requested a tank side table and luckily we were able to sit a row away from the tank (they had a party of 17 coming in that already reserved the seating right next to the tank).  The service was okay and the food was tasty, however I got food poisoning from the lobster mac so I'm not sure I would recommend it.  Overall it was a nice experience in the restaurant due to the fish tank.

I wish we had our $90 back. That's right, $90 for 2 bar drinks, 2 apps, a burger & fish and chips. The venison stuffed mushrooms were ok. The coconut shrimp were so tiny, it was barely enough to share. Those were delayed because the kitchen cooked 4 instead of 5. The fish on the fish n chips dish is a joke! It is so greasy, the breading is mushy. Bit into one and grease went down my chin. Didn't taste the fish, just the grease. Heard people get bread to start, but we didn't. Server steered me away from the all you can eat shrimp because it's just "boxed, frozen pre-breaded shrimp". What???? We are in Florida! The shrimp is boxed frozen shrimp? I think the worst part (which should have made us go right back out the door) is the lobby smells just like old fish. It's a very pungent, old raw fish odor. Bonefish or Red Lobster doesn't smell like that. The food was gross, the prices are outrageous. We won't be back and will NOT recommend it to anyone.

I was dying to try this place but ended up with take out only due to time constraints. I pray they operate a massive recycling center in the back because no free water (bottles only), combined with styrofoam everything, nearly guarantees them a spot in trash hell. Dumplings are very good but small and somewhat pricey - just 6 set me back $8. I've been told they are labor intensive to make but this seems extreme. There's no way i could bring my teens here and get them full for under $100. Again didn't stay to eat but seemed clean.

My friends and I are night owls and we love applebees for the awesome drink and apps specials and we go a few times a month.  That being said this past time going was the absolute worst experience I've ever had at an applebees or any restaurant really. 

Our server's name was Lorilyn(?) and she was just awful. We had to use the call server button just to get her attention after waiting 20 min to even get our drink orders. And then it took another 25 minutes to even get our drinks (some of which were wrong).  And then a half hour later we finally got our apps and still waiting on refills and for her to fix the wrong drinks but it sounded like she just completely forgot.  At one point we called the manager over and very calmly and politely pointed out all the issues we were having because at this point it had been like an hour and a half and we still didn't have the right drinks or even all the apps we ordered or even our food yet, but he did nothing to resolve any of it besides "I'll go check on your food"  it sounded like he didn't care at all.  And we're not ones to make a big scene and scream and moan over stuff so that's probably why he didn't actually do anything even though we were all very upset. 

We finally get our food and over half the table just decided to get a to go box because it had been two hours and we weren't expecting to be there that long.  It was just really awful because three of us ordered the unlimited chicken tenders and riblits deal but couldn't even use it because of how incredibly slow it was. And the restaurant was over half empty. 

As we were all checking out and getting ready to go we overhear our waitress badmouthing us.  Which was just absolutely unjustified because it was the worst service I've ever experienced and because we're good people we still tipped.  

Just awful overall and will never go back to this applebees.
Like University of New Orleans engineering better. No discount for first responders. You have to wait in line for a time limit on a machine because everyone is hogging up their time.

Been there three times. First time wasn't so bad, second time took my son and his fiancé and my wife. We all ordered at the same time but we all are at different times. The kitchen couldn't get our food out together. On a $150 bill I was a little disappointed. Manager caught wind of our issue through FB and told us to come back and drop her name and they would take care of us so we did just that. 
The food took 45 mins and was cold. The reason was they forgot we were there and bypassed our order to serve later customers. The poor waitress didn't get to find out I tip in $20 intervals meaning if the service is great I'll throw an extra twenty on top of the tip. I appreciate good hard working employees and waitressing isn't easy at all. Underrated really. 
There's some guest that grace restaurants with eating at those establishments. 
It's bad for business when you can't meet a basic standard. 
Our standard is high. This restaurant is not to par.
Sound "Snooty"? No. Basic expectations aren't Snooty and if a person considers it snooty then it shows how low the standard is for them. 
It's ok to expect your food within 45 mins. Of ordering. It's ok to expect the food to all come out at same time. 
It's a gamble to eat at Sams. Gamble my people won't take again.

Awesome place and good food. Had the cheesesteaks with mushroom cheese whiz (first time having cheese whiz) and the fries with old bay seasoning. It was awesome. The staff was on point and the place was comfortable. Barely got a sit even on a Sunday. Good place to eat in Philly.

My first time coming in today.  First impression was that it was very empty, so I was very surprised that the sushi chef asked me to seat myself.  Sushi was good for the most part but I hate when they put a lot of rice. So when I got salmon nigiri, I pick off a little bit of the rice. I had 3 tiny bits of rice on my plate and the server rudely stated "next time finish your rice, ok?"   I eat sushi at least once a week, this was the first time a server has commented on a little bit of rice left on the plate.  Inside one of the salmon was some black stringy substance so I did not eat that piece and he didn't like the fact I left one piece of nigiri on the plate as well. Price is on the high side. They didn't not refill my drink at all.  The sushi was pretty good though beside having too much rice on the nigiri.

Wonderful food in a quiet atmosphere (hard to find when visiting Mew Orleans). Had the stuffed crab, collard greens and Mac & Cheese.  Loved it! Greens were perfect!! Husband ordered red beans and rice with a side of sausage.  Yum!!
Absolutely delicious raw milk. The garlic cheddar was out of this world. I recently made the switch to grass fed beef and can't wait to see what Birchwood has to offer.

I came here and almost all the tables are highly top,l. It's difficult when you have a short wife or even if you're drinking you could easily stumble. The food is over priced, pretzel are frozen from a box, lemon for my water had mold residue, and my glass was cracked. Not only that I can see how terrible the management is to the severs. I asked a server how much they had to tip out to bartenders and it's nearly ridiculous. It doesn't seem like a great place to work or eat. Way to over priced and terrible management.

Ya know when you are so full, but you keep eating because the food is so delicious?!? Yup there is your warning! Visited on a Monday around 1pm. There was a line, but it moves quick. I ordered the Chicken Shack Ranch. So Good! 
Seating is limited, but it is worth visiting!

First trip to Nectar, food and service was amazing. The owner visited many times. Group of six, shared the Queso and Chips with guacamole, salsa and Pepita Hummus. All great but the best was the hummus, very unique. Bowls, fish tacos and quesadillas excellent. Will be returning soon!

This is just a lovely hotel! It feels so different than any other hotel I've stayed at. It's special and has a very thoughtful design that is all in the details! Our room feels like a place where we can really relax. It's contemporary style makes it very aesthetically pleasing but it also feels like home. They provide friendly service that is accessible but not overly so. This is a well conceived, very welcome addition to downtown Boise and I will seek out "boutique" hotels from now on for the unique experience it provides!

I bought 3 pair of shoes at Marti and Liz Franklin store yesterday. I came back today with one pair that did not fit correctly. The arch was not on right place in shoes. Clearly damaged from beginning. Shoes did have some wear. But as it's used shoes some have more wear than others. When I returned the employee said no we can't take those back in that condition. They are in the condition I bought them. So I asked for a manager. Who was rude and said nope sorry we are taking them back. The hostile attitude of the employees and arrogance is none matched by any store I have ever been too. There was no customer service. I was denied to use their return policy even though I had not had the shoes 24 hours. They said call the main office if I don't like it. This is a Christian company. Which mAkes it even more shocking. They sell used shoes! They are not in new condition. Yet then say they are not in return condition. SHOP AT YOUR OWN RISK! Do not count on their return policy. They are not honest.

Great location but parking an issue. They have 6 assigned spots a block and a half away. No happy hour on Sundays to watch the football games in two very nice bars they have there.

The rooms are not updated. Old TV that did not turn on nor off with the remote. Had to manually do so. They came to fix only to turn on the TV manually. No remote fix.

The sheets were not of fine quality and the shower situation was not ideal. 

I suggest having management sleep in each room every quarter of the year and make. List of improvements. 


Staff knew we were not thrilled and an irritated  sorry was there response to our complaints or suggestions. 

I won't be back...

Excellent customer service!!! Needed a cut and color last minute due to another salon cancelling my appointment. Savannah did my color and was so pleasant to talk to. And did a really great job. She really listened to what I wanted and also informed me on a lot about my hair and the care for it! Erica did my cut and I'm very happy with it! I will definitely come back!!
We were there for a Holiday party.  The food was good and hot, and the service was good.  We were a party of about 40 and would recommend going back.

This ACME is not much different from many of the other establishments in Philly. The one advantage is that the overall store is larger, but the amount of fresh fruits and vegetables (with emphasis on fresh) is a little bit of the disappointment side. The staff are a little bit more friendly than the center-philly location and the large parking lot makes it a bit more tolerable for lugging large quantities of heavy groceries. Overall, it's not bad and it does have some cheap sales from time to time.

I stayed here for 3 nights during a conference in November. These are some things I liked about the place:
1. The cookies that they gave during check-in. Those were great and came in very handy the first night when I was craving a late-night snack and the following morning when I did not get the chance to get breakfast and simply had a cookie, along with coffee that I could make in the room.
2. While Wi-fi wasn't provided for free to everyone, the bar was set fairly low. All you had to do was to provide your Hilton Rewards number and you could have access to wi-fi for free. While this means that people who haven't signed up have to do so to get the free wifi, it is still infinitely better than having to pay $11.99 or however much it is that Sheraton or Marriott wants to charge me when I spend one night at their hotels.

Here are some things that were not so great about the place:
1. The poor quality of the sound-proofing: I was on the 23rd floor of the hotel and yet the road noise from below was enough to bother me on two of the nights that I stayed at the hotel. That is one of my biggest peeves about hotels - if they invest in sound proofing their rooms, they can help their guests get a better night's sleep but some choose not to invest in that consciously. I have stayed at hotels on the Las Vegas strip where in spite of all the ruckus going on below, the rooms themselves were practically noise-free.
2. The quality of the food: Overall, very unimpressive. We had two lunches at the conference catered by the hotel and they were not inspiring. One of the lunches was better than the other but in general, they were not great. On the last day of the conference, I also ordered room service and again, I was not happy with the taste of the food. I had sausages that were overcooked to the point of being burnt; the scrambled eggs I had were not fluffy or well-seasoned - all in all, not the kind of food that makes you either happy or excited.
I stayed here for the sole reason that the conference was happening here. Given a choice to freely pick across hotels, this wouldn't be my first choice in the area by a long shot.

Extremely helpful with ideas regarding design and DIY installation.  Figured accurate quantity of tiles , grout, adhesive and Ditra.  Took additional time explaining use of Ditra in application.

We were looking for a specific tile which they did not carry or could not order.  The looked high and low, eventually locating a distributor out of state.  Presented ideas regarding a total gut of my kitchen and needed backsplash.  Would most definitely recommend them.

Christmas 2017 with my lovely husband and four year old daughter. Our first nontraditional Christmas ever, and I must say we were not the only ones to fill Desire. Waited in line for about 20 minutes. I had shrimp n grits, however, omitted the grits and had rice I stead...it was delicious! My husband had the Trio...it was cold and not anything near as yummy as the shrimp. Our waitress was off, but it was Christmas I'm sure she would have rather been at home than  serving us...in fact, that's basically what she said as she dropped off our ticket (totally understandable). I an on goi9g back next time we are in town.

I've been ordering food from them for almost 5 years now. Everything taste amazing & homemade! Not too salty & not too bland. Serving sizes are enough for 2 of me. The owner & staff are so welcoming every time, really makes you feel like your at one of your friends momma house! Lol

I walked in around 5 pm (love to be able to do that for massages) and they were able to give me a 40 minute back massage and foot reflexology at the simultaneously! Both were fantastic and reasonable priced
Food is good but the non alcoholic drinks are a bit of a joke, small 8oz glass loaded to the brim with ice and then charge $3.50 for juice?

I found working with all the team at Home Furnace & AC a positive experience. Celina in the office was pleasant and professional, emailing information in advance of Brad coming out to look at my set up and offer a recommendation and estimate for a heating/AC set up in my small mobile home.

The system his son, Dylan, and other technician, Sandro, installed works beautifully. They were hard workers, who did a great job and so nice as well.

I highly recommend calling Brad for advice regarding your furnace or AC needs :)

Nice, clean place, good Mexican food but not great

Bar does not have the same choices that Las Tres Marias had, but it is OK.  I need to sample a few more items before I write a thorough review, but so far the food was good, but not great.  Prices are OK.
I prefer Lafanda's in Edwardsville for this price range.
I also think their menu is just too big.  Cut down on the menu, offer less choices but do the things you do top notch.

Stopped in for  some food after hearing so many good things about his place. Let me tell you this...THE FOOD DID NOT DISAPPOINT! We had the shrimp creole and the shrimp and crepes! The creole was cooked perfectly! Great flavor and spices. The spice wasn't overbearing and shrimp cooked perfectly. Would give this meal a 10/10. The crepes and shrimp scared me because I've never had such a combination but man I was in for a surprise! Kudos to the chefs for balancing the savory flavor of the crepes and the spices of the shrimp. It was a beautiful dish and could eat this fish every day. This dish was definitely 100/100

Now in our 7th week (awaiting completion of a new residence not far away.) PERFECT. Not only the value..(monthly)..but this well run motel has a kitchenette in every room. It is comfortable and clean. Andy, proprietor has the best staff I have ever seen in a facility such as this. Megan Melia, Luz at the front desk are very helpful and really enjoy their job. Other support staff are most friendly and eager to be of service.

Costco is always great. Bulk purchases, cheap food court,  good prices on gas, unbeatable return policy.  The only reason why it lost a star is because it frequently gets backed up -- need to open up more registers when the line extends past the snack aisles.  Although I guess that happens at most costcos...

I was told to never come back...by an immature abusive host. The meal started out fine. Then the host, a young man, began verbally abusing his mom. Raising his voice, after she seemingly asked an innocent question about a contract. He threw a box in the air in exasperation. She got up with her coffee to remove herself quietly from the situation and he chased after her stating "Give me that, you don't deserve it". He was trying to pull a hot coffee from her hands. He turned to me to address my astonishment and noted he was "taking the coffee because it was unhealthy for her". She doesn't need the coffee? I'm pretty she also doesn't need a disrespectful abusive son!! That will kill her quicker than any coffee will. If he treats her like that in front of customers I can't imagine what it is like behind closed doors. I left crying, heart broken for the woman. All customers in the establishment got up and left. Grow up young man and learn to treat others with respect. Your family business now suffers because of your actions.
There's no words to describe this restaurant other than DELICIOUS! We had the mofongo and also fried snapper..AMAZING!

We liked it here.  We started with the hummus plate.  It was very good.  Both ordered burgers, mine came out as ordered...his came out well done (he asked for medium).  Server was efficient and pleasant.  My one complaint is that another couple was seated so close to us, we might as well have been a four-top.  I'm used to tight quarters, but this was very uncomfortable.

This is a very well maintained Civil War historical site. Be sure to take the tour of the inside of the Carter House - the guide is excellent and makes you feel what it was like to be in the middle of a major Civil War battle.
Paul
The service here is terrible. 4 rude ladies at the counter.  Simply wanted to add a driver.  Wow. What a terrible adventure

Great little coffee and healthy breakfast alternative stop.  The, albeit minimal, outdoor seating offers a gorgeous view. 
The egg sandwich was way more delicious than any scrambled egg sandwich has a right to be!
On ding is that the milk options for their many beverage exclude skim. The only dairy option is whole milk, with soy, almond and coconut the only other choices.  For someone with a lot of allergies (me) this was a problem. I can see it wouldn't be for many others, but it was a surprise for sure.

I have been going here for over 12 years. George is a great and honest mechanic, not to mention a very nice guy. I had previously gone to chain auto repair places such as Firestone and Pep Boys and I had nothing but problems. His prices are fair and even a little cheaper than dealers. I have had all kinds of work done here on various cars and everything was done quickly and correctly the first time.  George always calls and explains issues and prices before doing any work.

I highly recommend Carneys!

One of our favorite places in STL. 
Gals night out Sat began w/Drinks, dinner & dessert at The Fountain before a show at the Fox.  Everyone was greatly satisfied!
And look forward to our next visit!!!

Overall I really enjoyed my meal. My ribeye was cooked to correct temp and with the cheese and veggies on top (forget what they call it) was yummy. The Brussels sprouts were so good!  One thing my friend and I decided though was that we should have split one instead of getting one each. Towards the end of the meal we realized that our waitress never brought our tortillas. Neither of us are eating a lot of carbs so in the end it was ok.  Finally we picked this restaurant as it had two dollar signs signifying it was moderately priced. You may want to add a couple. I'll go back!

The food was good. I had Pad Tai and it was dry. The rest of the food was very good. Especially the coconut chicken soup. 
Wish they delivered!
Worst customer service ever! Very unwilling to help. Wasted an hour of my time.

High prices for what it is. I got a chicken salad and it was terrible. SOAKED in dressing with some gross dark meat chicken on it. Also got a pita that was very mediocre and also drenched in salty sauce. Won't be back!
This place rocks!  Staff is always super friendly and the Sunburst is like a vacation in your mouth!   Hyde Perk kinda reminds me of Cheers, just haven't figured out who Norm is yet

Being born and raised in NY, I consider myself a pizza elitist/snob.  I've gone to Barros three times and the pizza is good, but what brings me back are the wings (big and full of meat) Two dozen for little over 20 bucks. The mango habanero wings are fantastic! Nice to have a place to get wings close to home now!
This is the best, most consistent Mexican joint in St. Louis. Nothing fancy. Just great authentic food done right. The chicken nachos are wonderful. The service is fast and friendly.
We called AAA this morning and they sent a K&S tow truck, driven by Rob. He was very personable, respectful, knowledgable, and helpful. We're very appreciative!
An exceptional cup of coffee in a quiet beautiful spot. The barista makes his own almond milk, his pour is on point and the selection of goods is minimal but well curated.

Chose this as an out of towner looking for a good delivery place to our hotel. Ordered delivery and was brought timely. Shrimp Alfredo was outstanding and was the best thing we ordered! Pizza and bread sticks were both good as well.

Takeout service: I've ordered takeout of the Chicago deep dish pizza on a number of occasions. Each time has been on point with timing estimates - the usual 45 minutes.

Interiors - as the other reviews will tell you, this location is under renovation. I applaud that, as it appears it needed a facelift, and they're achieving that.

Chicago Deep Dish - the closest to true deep dish I've had, outside of Chicago. I always order the pizza with sausage; call it reminiscing my college days in Chicago! The cheese and crust are just what you should expect form a good deep dish pizza. Their sauce, although a rich blend of spices, is all their own, and "distinct" as Black Thorn's Dave has stated in some of these reviews.

In short, give this neighborhood spot a shot!

I have always loved Frost Gelato, but tonight there was truly something wrong with the gelato. I ordered my usual Gianduia-Chocolate with Hazelnut & it has never tasted like this before. My husband ordered a peanut butter and that was also not same flavor as before ( it had too much creme and not much peanut butter flavor, almost tasting like milk. My gelato tasted tart and something was off about it.   I had my husband taste my gelato as well as I tasted his and we both agreed there is something not right tonight.
So I went inside to tell the very young person behind the counter about how it tasted tart and not fresh. He turned and said to me, " well, we haven't changed the tray yet" Then he tells me that different Frost's locations sometimes have different colors/tastes and depends on "chef" who makes it & that it could taste different. I never heard anything like this before. This young "boy" offered me another one, but after his explanation I told him no longer interested and that I was throwing my gelato away in the garbage-and did so in front of him. He never said I will refund you.  He just watched me toss an entire cup away as did my husband. I did not care about the money but the fact he made excuses for something that was not right-is just wrong.
This is what happens to any good place turns into a Franchise. Any Pastry Chef will tell you making Desserts are like a science. Each measurement must be done right or it will never turn out the same. 
There must be a recipe they have to follow as well. 
Sorry Frost, I have supported you since you opened in Tucson but now, I will not eat Gelato in Tucson. 
I love gelato and fortunately I do travel, so I will have to wait to have my gelato when I return to Italy.

This is THE BEST and freshest pasta my fiancé and I have ever had, I have three cheese Italian ravioli with alfredo sauce (ravioli is hand made) and it was amazing! My fiancé had the Chicken Parmesan and we were surprised that it came with TWO chicken breasts. Our server was super friendly and helped us with the menu (showed us that you can build your own plate and what the different sizes of pasta noodle are) and constantly was making sure we had food and drinks. Would highly recommend this to ANYONE who likes fresh pasta. Really wish there was one closer to Franklin, Tn. I also never leave reviews for anything, good or bad so it takes a lot for me to leave one.

I have been taking my cars to Pep Boys for many years and have always received first class service, but recently the experience has even gotten better! I have a brand new car under 5,000 miles and picked up a slow leak in one of the tires. I brought it to the Pinellas Park store, they checked it out in less than 20 minutes, found a screw in the tire, fixed it and check the air in the other tires and they did this for no charge! That is what I call exceptional service!!! Thank you Pep Boys!!

Wow, super helpful employees. We came in to see what our check engine light meant and was cordial he greeted and treated respectfully. They even googled to see what the cost might be. Terrific service.

Walked in to get food to go. Hostess said to sit at the bar and we said we'd like a drink while we waited. My husband used the bathroom and no one ever came to me while I sat there. I used the bathroom afterward and walked out expecting to have a glass of wine at the table but my husband said they never even acknowledge him or asked what we wanted. So since we'd given them 15 min and the waitstaff was talking to each other instead of customers (it was dead BTW, Tuesday at 7 pm) we got up and left. Wouldn't waste your time.

Driving from Cincy to Milwaukee and craving some Cuban food since we don't have any at home. No disappointment here. Had the mini Cuban with black bean soup and husband had mini Cuban with plantains. We also got 4 guava pastries for the road. Delicious!

Another great spot to get a good cup of coffee! Great atmosphere inside with lots of tables to sit down and catch up with friends. Cafe au lait was excellent, the milk was steamed piping hot, just how I like it! They offer complementary simple syrup and honey as well. The entrance has the quintessential Instagram spot for your pics. Go nuts.

After many raves from friends, I decided to visit this restaurant on my short visit to NOLA. The meal was good. I was especially impressed with the croquettes and wild rice arancini. The wine list is extensive the cocktails we ordered were great and amazing aromatic. 

Unfortunately, the hospitality really hampered the entire experience. We arrived early for our late evening reservation that was not honored- we weren't seated until 20 minutes past our reserved time. This happens sometimes, but in this instance the hostesses seemed confused and began to seat us twice before they finally seemed to get it together. Meanwhile, loitering around the hostess station, is who I can only assume was the FOH manager based on his attire. He did not acknowledge what was going on. We were one of two parties waiting, and the dining room was maybe 3/4 full. 

Once seated, in the back next to the kitchen and a large party, we were not met with a waitress until another ten minutes had passed. She seemed flustered- maybe they were understaffed for the evening? The food came out quickly and was on point. There was no manager presence whatsoever during our visit.

I was very much looking forward to this experience, but even the strong culinary team will not be enough for me to return during future stays.

This is a real deal traditional Mexican restaurant.
They have $4.50 happy hour margaritas, tasty carnitas prepared properly and a full menu of yummy dishes, pork, chicken and carne.
Definitely recommend if your in the Pinellas Park area. Tucked in next to a tiny motel/ hotel place.
Friendly staff and enough booths and tables for parties bigger than 8. Parking lot is big enough.
I'm a SoCal native who has been enjoying Mexican food for decades.

Slammin. Fries are the on the thicker side. Always order grub hub and still crunchy. They cook my medium burgers perfect. Great bacon it's thicker cut and seasoned well. You can specialize every burger how ever you want and they have a lot of choices for toppings too. Also great drink choices

Ordered the chicken finger salad and a side of fries as takeout. It was ready in less than 15 mins and was directly across the street from the courtyard Marriott. The salad was good size. It has a House sauce on the chicken, which wasn't too bad, but a little spicy for my taste. The worst part of the salad was the croutons, which were greasy. I would get the salad again without the croutons. It came with a homemade ranch which I loved.

Easy 5 Star. Really nice ambiance, very relaxing with the low lights and plentiful candles. The service was very good and the prices really reasonable. We shared 5 rolls and had 2 miso soups and our bill was under 50 dollars. We had the dynamite, jazz, veggie, don taun, and Philly rolls. All were delicious and very fresh. They had a huge menu with many options. Everything sounded good. A must try!

Dee-lish food, good variety. German/Austrian twist offers different dishes from schnitzel to spaetzel to Lukelly.  If looking for American dishes of salmon and steak, they have that, too. Desserts were homemade with whipped cream made from scratch. Outstanding!  Cappuccino, iced Viennese coffee all winners. Service was superb. 
Plenty of parking. Cheerily and tastefully decorated for the holidays. Very comfortable seating. Serves beer and wine, too. Portions are so generous, everyone in our party of 6 took home leftovers. 
All around winner.

Dont shop here... The furniture is crap... Breaks in less then a year... You will wait a month for the part and servive to find out wrong part sent and start all over... Customer service is horrible... 45 minute hold times

Love this place. I wish they would expand though. It's too good to keep small. Always good food, great variety, great service. 
I love that it's a "center city" worthy spot that's right in the NE. You definitely need reservations though. This place is almost always full.

Stopped in for brunch around noon after calling to our our name on the waitlist. We waited about 20 mins before being seated inside. When the doors are shut it can get really loud so if you're looking for an intimate conversation over a meal, this isn't the place. 

I opted for the oyster Benedict which was full of flavor! Two poached eggs on the softest and fluffiest biscuits with creamed spinach and a spicy hollandaise sauce made this one of the best Benedict's I've ever had. On the side were a handful of perfectly fried oysters that gave some texture to the meal. I also ordered a side of fried green tomatoes that were crispy and paired well with the spicy dipping sauce. I'll definitely be back!

This was my first time trying Three Carrots and i was satisfied. I am vegan and typically i don't eat out much. This was a great way to break up my normal routine. I went on a Wednesday night, i had to park a block away. The walk would have been appreciated more if the winds weren't so terrible. 

I came with my best-friend and my son. The hostess originally  wanted to sit a 4 year old in a bar chair. I kindly let her know this wasn't appropriate - especially when there was a table available for us to sit comfortably. The restaurant was pretty bright, which i liked, i could easily see the menu. There wasn't a wide variety of beer or wine maybe 7 options combined. This wasn't an issue but I'm hoping soon they will pick up a contract with a local distillery. 

The food was ok. I loved the smothered seitan! But, the macaroni and  cheese needed a lot of help. I've been to other vegan restaurants in the past and noticed this same issue. It just doesn't compare.. it could be the milk they use or just the cheese substitute but it shouldn't be apart if the menu until perfected. The mashed potatoes were ok, they needed a little more seasoning but overall it was good.  The gravy taste great but looked very thick. 

Overall my experience was ok. I'll definitely go back and try different options! The only reason this review is a 4 and not a 3 is because i really want to see this restaurant be great! I know with time it has the potential to be amazing!

What an absolutely lovely place. I love Christmas/holiday decor and I adore it, even more, when it aligns with the glittery, white, charming wintery-swan-snow style. Immediately, when you walk in, you sense the amount of heart, love, and attention to detail in this stunning spot. As you enter, the bakery cases are open and filled with enticing treats that are beyond beautiful, and the decor gives you a pleasant visual overload.

Cake Bake Shop has a smaller but charming lunch menu filled with quiches and French-inspired fare. I had the chicken salad croissant, which actually had glitter on it! Now, the concept of eating glitter doesn't always appeal to me, but I swear you can't even taste it. Its so out there, but coupled with the ambiance of the business, it works. You also must try one of their sparkling cocktails - mine was too beauteous to even drink and had a floating edible hibiscus!

During lunch, I was operating in a tighter time crunch to catch a flight. I really appreciated that the team was speedy with my entree and cut my piece of cake early! The French silk pie was so delicious I could cry and served beautifully. Whether you live in Indianapolis or are just visiting, you must make a visit here. Its so easy to see why its adored by locals, guests and celebrities alike.

I like the fresh clean eclectic  menu and the portions are plentiful. Prices are the only downside. I noticed a price increase by $1 and $2 - hours are strange but they do update ahead of changes made.

Staff is super professional and courteous. Sabrina and her son have brought a taste of Belize to Reno and much needed to spice up the downtown reno gentrification. 

This is a great place for a business lunch or dinner, I even seen it rented out for private events and weddings. Enjoy the West Market Court yard during the warm weather.

Hugely inconvenienced w/ having to come back 3 times to get these letters ordered 2 days ago (and owner fully aware and involved in my service but didn't seem to have any regard for my time/trouble). Also, the N unfortunately isn't as lucky as the M.  All the other letters match in size/shape. I ordered them individually wrapped, but said I'd do myself since they weren't done.  $25.25 for 14.25 oz of chocolate letters that caused a lot of frustration on my part.

Fast and friendly service with an ecclectic decor. We were here to visit with friends and had a great time.  They had a terrific prime rib special served with a bad potato. We also ordered a spinach and cheese ravioli with shrimp. The food was great, we look forward to our next visit.
Best brunch I've had in New Orleans. Shrimp bloody Mary's, fried green tomatoes. What more can you ask for.

Everything here is always consistently really good!
The pizza is probably hands down best in this city. 
Tonight's special "chicken Pot Pie"! I've never had one this good before! It was Fantastic!
And lastly (the best for last) the owner and entire staff are great!

My girlfriend and I were in the mood for Mexican and saw that this place had really great Google reviews. Our GPS seemed to have a really hard time finding it. When we finally did find it, we realized it was attached to the Bayside Inn Hotel on US19. We almost didn't go inside as we drove around the building and noticed that the hotel seemed to house less than savory folk. We were starving though, and just figured we'd go inside to take a look. We were instantly pleased with the service we received upon entering. The waitress was very pleasant and the establishment was clean. We ordered the house margaritas, which were delicious. We ordered the Vallarta fajitas for 2, which was a combination meat fajita platter. It arrived fast, was seasoned perfectly, and actually probably could have served 3-4 people. We spent $44 for 4 margaritas and the $23.99 fajita platter, which we felt was fair. I believe we now have a new favorite Mexican spot. It's a shame it's attached to the hotel, and isn't easily identifiable. It deserves its own building. We will be back. Thanks for the great food and service!

I found this awesome place while playing Pokemon Go (2 gyms in the parking lot). The workers there are very cool and friendly. I was offered help and samples of their different brews immediately upon entering. The guy who helped me was very knowledgeable about how the beers were brewed and what went into each batch.

I ended up buying a custom 6-pack of three of their beers: Tripel Horse, Belgian Freeze, and Oatmeal Milk Stout. All the brews were very smooth and had no lingering after taste like Heineken, bleh.

I'm not a beer lover (I only love vodka), but the River Horse brews are TASTY, creamy, and rich. It's nice to savor my drink instead of drinking to get drunk. I definitely need to get my air fryer so I can enjoy more River Horse brews with some fish n chips!

Overall, I'm very pleased with their product and I'm happy that a local, family run NJ brewery is doing very well!

St. Louis is always little slow on food trends, but I was super excited to hear poke was finally starting to arrive!

This place has been on my radar even before it opened, thank you social media. My spouse and I checked out PokeDoke for dinner one night. Parking was pretty difficult to find, but it's to be expected as this restaurant is located in CWE.

I was having trouble figuring out which of the three sizes to choose. Small, regular, or large. I decided to go with the small which came with two scoops of protein. I had two scoops of the salmon with a base of white rice. I went with the medium poke sauce, but I think I'm going to go with the spicy next time. Toppings: mango, seaweed salad, masago, green onion, friend onion, and wasabi, all topped with a drizzle of wasabi mayo.

I'm not sure I can say it's the best poke I've ever had in my life, but it sure was tasty. The salmon was pretty good, I liked the poke sauce that was used. The toppings went really well with the meat and the rice. I really just see poke as a deconstructed sushi roll, which I already love. I was really surprised as to how full I was at the end of the meal. Though I chose the smallest size, I was pretty stuffed. If I had chosen the regular size, I would've been very uncomfortable.

I thought prices were fair. A small bowl is $10, while a sushi burrito from Blk Mkt Eats was $9 or $10. Not a big difference.

A new go to spot! Ordered take out and was very happy with how my meal held up during the transport. The guacamole is definitely a must, along with the mango chicken taco. The taco menu has a great variety-which means I will have to go back again to try them all. :) The staff was friendly and helpful, I look forward to eating in and getting the full experience.

Worst Howl at the Moon EVER. I am not one to leave a bad review but the ignorance of the staff at this venue was so disappointing I couldn't help myself. I have been an avid Howl patron for over 10 years, spending 2-3 nights a week there during my college years. Needless to say it has always been my favorite bar and top choice for a night out. I've been to several locations and I am by no means a "cheap" person, I'll pay for great entertainment in a fun atmosphere! My boyfriend and I were in town for a wedding this past weekend so since we do not have a Howl at home I decided we should stop by. At about 8pm we arrived and we were told we needed to pay a $10 cover charge to get in, no biggie! We walk in, go to the back bar which was less crowded and stand there for about 10 minutes while bartenders and servers just stare...ok maybe this bar isn't open? We go to find a table and ALL of the tables in the entire place were reserved, along with HALF of the already crowded bar roped off for a special event. I go back to the man who changed me $10 for entry and asked him if all tables were reserved and he proceeds to tell me "yes we have a lot of private parties tonight" . I'm very reasonable I know it's right before the holidays and companies are doing Christmas parties but DO NOT charge someone $10 to get into your overcrowded bar with NO public seating while everyone else in the bar is drinking and eating for free and then try to tell me there is a public table in the back of the bar with zero visibility to the stage or entertainment. He didn't even offer a refund when I told him we were leaving after being there for 5 minutes. You want me to then pay for your $6 beers but I can't sit down or see what's going on? What a disappointment. The Howl on my cruise ship was a million times better than this wannabe piano bar!

This is a very nice hotel near downtown Boise. It's conveniently close to the university, downtown, and the airport. It's quiet and clean. The rooms have recently been remodeled. We had a suite, so we had a very nice kitchen and full size fridge. The hotel is close to several restaurants and fast food joints if you don't want to make use of the kitchen. There is a grocery store and at least one drug store nearby if you need to run out for anything. A free shuttle service is available to and from the airport. The suite was comfortably sized. This is a great place to stay for a business trip or pleasure visit.

Stopped for breakfast ... service was quick and pleasent ...  Food was really good, bacon panini and loved the potatoes it comes with.  They also don't feel the need to charge extra for soda instead of coffee ... I'm good with that

Beautiful building.  Good location.  Polite service.

Rooms themselves are average appearance and quality.  We had trouble with room keys not working. We had plumbing problems in both rooms.  Grey water backed up into showers.  Difficult to park without valet which costs $38 per day.  Recommend factoring it into the cost when comparing.

This is an amazing buffet.  Really good food, adequate parking, and good location if you live or work near the Feather Sound area.  Good service as well.

The buffet is large and everything I've ever tried has been really good to great.

Snoballs are definitely hit or miss and this was a miss for me. They got points for their hours and proximity to my house, but I did not enjoy the flavors. The staff was friendly and there wasn't a wait, but I doubt I'll be back.

My husband and I frequent this restaurant, whether for eating in or for takeout. Never had a bad meal. Pizza is great, best crinkle cut fries around, cheesesteaks are true Philly steaks and even their salad dressings are awesome - the Ranch dressing is incredible and we order it with everything! Even better was our visit yesterday with my parents. My father has Celiac disease. Ron's has a dynamite Gluten Free menu which we learned bc the owner has several family members with gluten intolerance. There are lots of options and they have a separate fryer for making certain foods, like French Fries which are often a delicacy when dining out for someone with a gluten intolerance. My father was so delighted. We shared a large basket of fries. He had the eggplant parm with GF pasta and enjoyed every bit of it. Service is always great. They also offer the R.O.C.K card which gives rewards based on $ spent. 
This is a great place in Chester County. Highly recommended!

We eat a lot of pizza!  Came here after my wife had some of their pizza at work. This is one of the best pizzas I have ever had!   It was also some of the friendliest staff!  They were so nice a d the pizza so good!!   All in a cozy local neighborhood setting. Will definitely be going back!!

Their dishes are authentic but with the fair prices. Really satisfied after eating here, highly recommend family to come here to have their dinners! If you are a fan of Taiwanese cuisines, this is a good option :)

Very cute atmosphere, I thought it was a little expensive but the food was very good and the fruit seemed very fresh so it was worth it. Clean and quite comfy place. Enjoyed everything but it took a while to get food even though they weren't that busy. Staff were nice and friendly but didn't act like they had anything to do.
FALSE ADVERTISEMENT!!! That hot sign is always on & I rarely get hot donuts. Turn off the light sometimes
This place is just plain good. You can taste the fresh! I will be back and I'm just in town for a couple days! If you enjoy food that actually came from the earth than you will definitely enjoy.
Awesome place! Good sandwiches for your moneys worth & its even nice inside  considering making this my new sub shop
the staff is amazing. the food epic! try to fish tacos. delish! everything I imagined and beyyer. all around Winner!!!

Was happy to hear that New Orleans has a number of restaurants open during the Christmas holiday. My fiancé and I came here for Christmas dinner and really enjoyed ourselves. We ordered 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and 1 cocktail. 
Appetizer was Gnocchi which though decent, the sauce it was dressed in tasted like pizza rolls from my childhood. Definitely pass on those next time. 
I ordered shrimp and grits - very flavorful and well seasoned. My fiancé ordered the rib eye which came with fries. We were happy when the food came out because the portions were appropriate. Cocktail was great and definitely strong so worth the cost. 
Overall really nice time and good ambiance.

First time ordering from here. And we were wowed. Great pizza--the crust was excellent--wings were delicious, and a freebie order of jalapeno poppers came with. Looking forward to the next time we get delivery to try more of the pizzas.

Closed down? I can't even believe it. It's only been two months since I was there, but I've been dreaming about it. The frybread with green chile was absolutely delicious, the best I've ever had. It was a giant portion, too. I hope the owners can bring it back. It was awesome!

I have yet to receive test results two months later for my annual pap and they also tried to charge me twice for my appointment.  They also didn't send my birth control prescription to the pharmacy either so I had to wait a month to start taking them. I asked them to just hand me the prescription instead of calling them. They seem very disorganized and incompetent. The nurse practitioner was very nice though and gentle.

Great food in an area that most tourists will visit during their time in New Orleans. We visited for lunch while exploring and found that dress is more casual at lunch. Don't shy away at lunch if you are dressed casually! 

The dill bread to start was delicious and interesting since dill is fairly underused at restaurants. I started with the House Salad that was a bit of a flop, but helped me meet my vegetable requirements. There was plenty of greens with onions and manchego, but the delicious dressing wasn't mixed in properly. The salad tasted like it had been drenched in salt too. My husband started with the Crab Cake and that was delicious! It had nice pieces of crab and a definite creole flavor with the seasoning. 

I ordered the Shrimp & Grits which was delicious. The shrimp were good and the sauce and grits were tasty. The flavors of this dish were spot on. My husband ordered the Etouffee Pasta and that was probably the best food of our entire trip. The flavor of this dish was outstanding. Despite liking my meal I would definitely order this next time. 

Our waiter was friendly and professional. The restaurant was busy, but we were still taken good care of for our dining experience.

This is a pretty cool local bar. Went there on a Monday night, not a lot of people there at all. Bartender was good. We just had a few beers. They have a takeout beer section too. Highlights: 2 small size pool tables which were really nice. All the cues were pretty beat up though. They also had a shuffleboard table and dartboard. I didn't eat there, so I'm not sure how the food is. My experience was average. Since then, I've been here about 4 more times, pretty much only to play pool. It's a dive bar but the upstairs is pretty cool when it is open. (Usually after 7pm) They have another pool table up there too.
Update- we come here all the time now, honestly, the experience is hit or miss depending on the the bartender. Most are cool and do a great job, but some are so terrible it makes me not want to come back.

Absolutely love this place, my son is a VERY picky eater and I ordered him a fish plate and he ate every bit of it then asked me to go buy him another one. The breakfast is the best. Those grits are so creamy and delicious. And lord let's not forget about the sweets

Great place, great staff, great beer. The owners are always on site and are very welcoming. It's obvious to see how proud they are of their place and the process, for good reason! Many of the beers are on the lower abv spectrum (by today's imperial standards), but each is done with care to produce full bodied and fresh pint. The stout and porter are roasty and perfect for the Winter. They have a double IPA that packs a punch, and the rest of the ales are very well balanced...you can't go wrong here. Swing by for one or fifteen, you'll love it.

I can't tell you how exciting it is to find a restaurant that not only has gluten-free options, but is entirely gluten-free. Everything on the menu is safe and delicious. 
I had the Italian sandwich on garlic bread (a little slim on the meats), and a lemon cupcake. Everything was so good that people who are not gluten-free would enjoy it as well. 
I finished my meal and I feel great! It's been a rarity to be able to say that these days, and I will absolutely return if I am back in the city again!!

Very friendly staff! I like that I get to stay in my car the whole time and be walked through the process of what they are doing to my car and when. Was in and out in 15 minutes. A bit on the expensive side, but they offered an online coupon I didn't even know about. I thought that was excellent customer service!
This food was very good and the service was fast and friendly. A wide variety of dishes, chicken, beef and vegan.
Great restaurant. Excellent food and dessert choices. My favorite is the chicken salad croissant sandwich. Also their soups are delicious. Th Homemade biscuits with butter is also a favorite.

Very nice restaurant in the heart of downtown Boise. The menu had a nice selection and the food was delivered well without issue. Everything was fresh and flavorful, I had the beet salad and the prosciutto chicken.  The chicken was cooked perfectly and the dish blended together very well.

The food was very good and portions were large. However, the service was not the greatest. 
For that reason, I had to give it four stars. 
And it was not cheap. 
All in all, if they can work on the service, an above average steakhouse.

Good location within walking distance of most attractions downtown. Stayed in a guest king Room was nice and clean had a view of the arch. Powerpoints could be placed in easier areas for access and have two bed side tables would be better. Bathroom was nice and shower very big.

We took our two fur babies to Petcetera for bathing and Stacy was the groomer.  If you know anything about Yorkies, they are particular little creatures, and these two seem to sense that they're going to suffer at the vet or groomer.  They quiver and shake themselves right to sleep.  However, these two walked boldly into Petcetera (maybe because it's on Magazine Street?) for their extensive bathing, including nail trim, teeth brushing, eyes cleaned and a few other things for $25 each.
