What a great place--they even offer self service for brave pet parents--an elevated tub to wash your fur babies for only $12.  

Petcetera's wide selection of grooming and pet care products, clothing, costumes, accessories, and food items is amazing.  Unique, one of a kind and quality products.

The best breakfast, lunch, brunch spot in Tucson hands down. The food is great. The staff are the best, even new hires prep and pastry knows how to pick who is right for the job. Chefs at both locations are spot on. I love the food there. I've nearly tried the entire menu, and always up for what chef Hannah has to offer with the French toast. I love both locations central and east

Verdict: It's not the original but it's not a bad alternative at the airport.

This place is located in the outskirts of the airport terminals, in what seems to have the local food offerings. You'll also find the Philadelphia Pretzel Factory right across the food court. The Tony Luke's here isn't cheap by any stretch but you'll pay the premium when in need of a Philly fix.

I loved going to the original Tony Luke's before they started popping up everywhere. They made a decent cheesesteak but you could get that in a lot of places in Philly. This place probably does a better job than most with their pork sandwiches.

Looking for that familiar flavor, I ordered the roast pork with broccoli rabe. There wasn't anything really on the lighter end but I did find and order the cooked spinach side dish. The sandwich was exactly what I expected and I enjoyed every bite. The spinach side was tiny and a bit salty but otherwise good.

Even though this terminal is at the far end, there's a shuttle that brings you right here from one of the more central locations. If you have the time and crave some more authentic local cuisine, this place might be worth the trip.
You should experience this one by your own. It's mostly about the feeling and tradition here, however I love the taste too. My favorite: Strawberry shortcake!

Dangerous place to shop at night. Manager turns off half the lights, completely darkens the produce section, the employess are unhappy and get hurt on the job re: lack of light. Had to use cell phone flash light to see in places. Their offerings are wonderful, but the poor attitude and the darkend aisles are scary. Stay open or stay closed, but don't treat people this way. I may never come back. I have been there previously with great results, but tonight's visit was really beyond the pale. Workers don't want to engage with customers when they are asked for assistance. Seriously, why stay open? Shop Rite, Acme, and Fresh Grocer (the old Pathmark) are close by. SAD

I am not sure why this restaurant has such high reviews.  The quality of food is okay and the prices are high.  They do not have a lunch menu and most Thai restaurants serve soup and egg roll with lunch.  I will not go back because there's too many Thai restaurants with lower prices and better quality food as well as a nice lunch menu with lots of options.

I am disappointed every time I eat here & never leave full. The description for everything sounds great on the menu but the food never looks or tastes like what you're expecting or hoping for. Place is clean & employees are nice, plenty of seating, decent prices but after 4-5 tries, I won't be back.

Prices are extremely fair, portions are generous, quality is high, and the food is delicious! Whether you order the delicious Baja burger or a portion of rotisserie chicken, your meal will be extremely flavorful, and filling. They are well worth a try!

It's very hard to get me upset about rude people especially those in the service industry; However, I can say that the service desk employees here are a lost cause.  They are rude every single time come here, never make eye contact, and symbolically and sometimes literally roll their eyes every time you ask for some assistance. It's a real bummer.

This is actually a solid spot for the money. They have some surprisingly awesome hibachi tofu, so crispy and cooked better than other more upscale joints I frequent in St Pete.
Great price, small plates but you can order as much as you want and get a chance to try a few things.
Besides sushi and hibachi, they have a few chinese dishes. They lack eel for sushi but other than that its pretty good for all you can eat. One thing I would improve is the soy sauce, seems like they use the cheap low sodium kind.

Went in for a last minute dress shirt. While expecting to be "pretty woman'd" due to looking like a homeless person, every one was very helpful in finding me the perfect shirt and size just in time for my event. Will be returning, thank you!

Disappointed today. Took my family to the Christmas show and had a blast. Went to the Brew Brothers and was very disappointed. We started out with chips and salsa with the guacamole. I tasted the guacamole and it was spicy to me. Even my wife who likes spicy items said it was a little hot, and she's Mexican. I asked the waitress what was in the guacamole and she did not know. Later she said it was jalapeño. I'm can't have anything spicy due to an ulcer. I told the waitress why don't you tell people it has jalapeño in it? She did say anything.             So we order and I had the smoked chicken and pineapple. At that time I asked for more water and my daughter asked for ranch. A few minutes later our food arrived everyone but mine. The waitress said it would be only a few minutes. So everyone started eating. 10 minutes later I man came over and apologize for my dinner said they had some problems in the kitchen and it would be a few minutes. So about 5-7 minutes my chicken arrived. Now my family was mostly done eating. I looked at my plate and it's small chicken peace's with chunks of pineapple. Not much chicken. The bbq sauce was lightly poured on to it. So I tried it and no smoke flavor and it was very dry. I was expecting a little more the that.  The waitress forgot our water and ranch dip we had to ask several times. No apology or compensation for the spicy guacamole or dinner issue. I'm not saying I should get a free meal but come on, try to make it right!

As a vegetarian/vegan for over 15+ years, this place is so worth the stop. I wish it was a little bigger, but it fit the bill for me, my wife and my 3 year old. DOPE Food, seriously I need this in Maryland.
We loved this bar!!  The bartenders and drinks were great.  The bands were amazing.  We had a lot of fun here!  We will definitely be back to Layla's!

Absolutely tasty, fresh, and delicious.  This was a spur of the moment decision and I'm glad we stopped by.  Manager came by half way thru the meal and checked on us.  It was a great experience and we'll be back.

So I've been to this particular Yolk before and I'll start by saying that the food is pretty good. Our waitress was friendly and efficient and everything. The cheesy grits could be better. They're kind of dry and thick. Could be a little creamier but the pancakes were delicious and my friend ordered the strawberry orange juice and he said it was delicious. But my complaint I have with this particular location is their process for seating. There's no clear, distinct sign that says where to put your name on the list. We waited for a while before being told by the hostess seating people that you had to visit the counter to be added to the waiting list. There's a young girl with a tablet in front of her just standing there not paying attention to anyone who walks in the door. If it's your first time visiting this establishment you'd be totally confused. They should definitely have a better system. She eventually took our name down and said it would be 30-35 minutes for 2 people. That's interesting because the bar counter had plenty of empty spaces. We waited for about 10 minutes and we still ended up being seated at the counter which was previously empty when we put our name on the list. Not sure what time frame the hostess was on but she was clearly confused but don't know why it took us even that long to be seated when there was seating available immediately. I also noticed a couple that came in after us was seated at a regular table before us. Made my experience less than stellar so I probably won't be back anytime soon just based on that. Especially since it's not the only brunch spot in the area. Just saying!

My hubby and I have lived out in the Spanish Springs area for over 20 years and started coming in when this one was opened. We used to hang on the Smokin' side as we felt more comfortable over there, the smaller vibe and the bartenders were always great.

But we started coming to the non side in the last year or so more often. We used to try over there on and off through the years but it always had kind of a strange vibe and it had such a warehouse feeling to it. We like to sit at the bar and feel welcome and comfortable, we enjoy gambling and having some food & drinks. We've finally found it started having a nicer vibe when David and Jo started working behind the bar during the evening hours which is when we frequent the place. We always get great, friendly and fast service. And we no longer feel out of place, we feel welcome. My hubby and I have gone to many, many bars through the years on our travels and local and we love meeting and getting to know our bartenders, many have become friends to us near and far. It definitely makes the difference to want to hang out and enjoy the gambling. It takes special personalities to be good bartenders and keep your business up, not just anyone can do it. We will actually choose not to go to bars on certain nights based on who is working. We don't want to spend our hard earned money if we're not going to enjoy ourselves.
Clean and well maintained location, as one would expect of a Walgreens. No complaints. It was a well stocked store, clean, with nice wide aisles that allow a little breathing room as you browse.

This is a really awesome piercing shop. The artists are really nice and telling me as much as information before start piercing. I got a septum piercing. It was quick, you take a deep breath and exhale and it's done like magic. And the position of the septum is not too high or too low, it's exactly where I wanted. As a traveler in New Orleans. I really recommend this piercing shop to anyone who's new here.

Where do I start? This place is amazing! Our bartender was so nice and attentive to us.  None of that waiting for a drink for an hour without even a glance or "I'll be right with you". The pizza here is fantastic.  I'm from the east coast, so I'm a tough critic.  It's TJ's which I'm told is only a frozen pizza! When we walked in the pianist was playing Elvis.  How cool!  I had just an overall fun time here.  I will definitely come back when I'm in town!

I typically order the same thing every time ..with that being said I LOVE their honey chicken, miso soup, and sushi. I've never had a bad experience and the food always shows up within 20-30 minutes and tastes fresh!

This place is absolutely divine!!! We started off with the the whipped feta with bacon... great addition to any meal. The butternut squash soup was superb! The fire roasted carrots are always a family favorite. The sweet papas bravas stole the show!!! It was truly amazing!!! One of my all time favorites. As our main entree we got the crispy avocado rice with chicken. It was awesome! We ended the night with a the butternut squash ice cream cake. It was a beautiful dessert and tasted even better. Tonight was truly, delectably exquisite!!!!

Tired Hands Fermentaria reminds me of that old chestnut: There was a little girl, who had a little curl, right in the middle of her forehead. And when she was good, she was very very good. And when she was bad, she was horrid. 

Pretty much sums up Fermentaria in a nutshell. The beer? Always good. The food? Not so much. When it is good, it's great. When it's bad? It's really bad. Case in point, the fish tacos. Which I confess to having gotten several times. Until the visit when they arrived with a distinctly fishy odor that haunts me to this day.

And then there are the hipsters. My problem with hipster-owned restaurants is that they act like it's a privilege for YOU to be patronizing THEIR restaurant. Good customer service - a truly memorable dining experience - is the polar opposite.

========================
Update: I visited today and was so blown away by the pretzel appetizer that I had to login and add a star back! Nom, nom, nom!!!

Outstanding flavors on each pizza.  The arugula salad is great too.  The flavor of the crust makes one not want to leave any pizza bones behind on the plate.  They also just got their liquor license so you can have a local Dragoon beer with your pizza.  I think the sausage pizza is my fave - spicy and delicious.  Best pizza in Tucson!

Mmmmkay, what the f*ck. I went to UCSB, have been back multiple times, and now live downtown. How have I never heard of this place?? Centuries old buildings? Live music? Bikers, bbq, beer??? You need to come here!

Service & atmosphere: so we decided to eat inside the actual Cold Spring Tavern first and then sit outside for a beer afterwards. Inside is UNREAL. Since it was built in the 1800s, its the perfect building to look around at all the history, feel like Laura Ingalls Wilder, and wonder how the shit this building is still standing! It's cozy, warm, and so quaint! Service was quick, friendly, and attentive as well. 

Food: So my friend and I split chili cheese fries and ribs, since we were on a diet... The fries were yummy, coming from someone who doesn't even like chili! The ribs were juicy, fall-off-the-bone, and I could have easily eaten the half rack myself. 

Outside, there's a bunch of picnic tables where you can have their famous tri-tip, listen to music, and bring your drinks from the log cabin bar. People-watching is amazing since the crowd is veeeery different than your normal yuppie, White-linen, blonde SB crowd. Families, bikers, couples, and friends made up a much more diverse crowd, which was very refreshing. 

The place is so picturesque and the food was comforting and delicious. I'll be back with my parents, and any other visitors, in tow!

I absolutely love iPho. I've been coming here quite a lot for their vegetarian pho, summer rolls and banh mi's. Every time I go the food is incredible. The tofu is crispy perfection and the banh mi's taste sooo, so good. Their vegetable broth is also amazing and I prefer their pho over anyone else's overall. On top of that, our servers are always very polite and accommodating!

This is a memory/meditation garden. Plenty of benches along the trail, some of it is paved or you can walk through the trees. Parking lot behind the garden, but it seems that the locals park along the road.

Food is pretty good. Big fan of the chicken sandwich. Ask for a side of the hop hands mustard for the fries. Beer is always top notch. What I can't stand is the entitlement that exudes from the waitstaff. A bearded hipster with an attitude problem shouldn't be talking down to a paying customer. On top of that the noise levels are just too much. I get the idea of beer garden style layout with no walls or partitions but you have to draw a line somewhere. Besides the waitstaff being hit or miss and the noise. This place is still enjoyable

Great experience, great food. We had a reservation for a busy Friday night and were seated as soon as we all arrived. They have a diverse menu and our table had seafood, chicken, ribs and steak. Everything was tasty, and their seasonal menu was full of flavor. We're will happily return here!

We just ate there tonight. We were there over the summer for the first time.  The food is always amazing with huge portions.  Each time we had a reservation and each time we waited 40 extra minutes to be seated and each time they have sat us at the same table right by the front door.  Since it is freezing out tonight, I was not happy.  It seems like there is a boatload of "regulars" that are there and they seem to get preferential treatment. It was so loud and crowded at the bar that it made waiting for our table painful. The manager did come to us and apologize and offered free appetizers which was much appreciated. However twice now we made reservations weeks in advance and had to wait forever and got the same dinky, drafty table by the front door.  My feeling is that people known to the staff are treated much better.

My family ate here last night. My daughter loved the avocado rolls; I loved the tofu and vegetable teriyaki. My wife loved the miso soup -- "flavorful," "hot," "inexpensive." It was the best tofu I've ever eaten. Soft, and smooth on the inside; crispy on the outside. Drizzled with delicious teriyaki sauce. We also enjoyed the Udon stir fry. We weren't sure about coming in, because it was empty, but we are so glad we did. After we ordered, another couple came in; they were regulars who greeted the server and the sushi chef by name. We plan to stop in Mount Laurel again, just to eat here again.

This review is based on bad service. I drove 10 minutes to get my food. I ordered 12 tenders and asked for extra Zaxby's sauce. They lady at the window said are you sure they get two already. I said yes I'm sure, so she charged me for the extra sauce. I get home and there is ONE SAUCE!!!! Are you kidding me. How hard is it to add the extra sauce that I pay for!!! I will not be back here. The sauce is what makes everything so good.
Really nice staff that made excellent recommendations.  Had a acai bowl and immune tea and the tea was brewed perfectly and the acai bowl was out of this world.   Highly recommend this place.

Upland Nachos

A coworker and I took off early on a Friday to enjoy shooting some guns at the local gun range and then enjoy some food and drinks nearby at Upland Brewery's Tap House in Carmel, IN. Upland Brewing Company is actually based out of Bloomington, IN but this tap house in Carmel is a nice little getaway as not only do they have delicious craft beer but great food too! On this particular visit we shared two dishes. This review is focused on the Upland Nachos with Pulled Pork.

To start my review let me begin with the APPEARANCE of this dish. I will be honest that my first thought was "Wow, that's a lot of tomatoes!" and the thought had crossed my mind that there was just way too many vegetables on this plate. As I look at the picture above and refresh my memory of the plate the look of the nachos is very eye appealing as the tomatoes have a fresh and vibrant red color and the placement of the fresh jalapenos really jumps out too.

Nachos are a tough dish to review because there's two main trains of thought on the cheese. One train says to use runny nacho cheese and pour it over all the chips and stuff. The second train says to use shredded cheese and melt it at the end. I tend to lean more towards the first train when it comes to nachos...nacho cheese that's gooey and sticky and that unique after taste that nacho cheese has over cheddar, mozzarella, or colby jack cheese. So putting my "preference" aside on how I like my nachos, the overall flavor profile of this plate is quite astonishing. The pulled pork topping is definitely a bonus, but the nachos by themselves without the pulled pork are still worth a taste. If you get a little bit of everything on a chip then it will EXPLODE your taste buds. The veggies are crisp, the chip is crunchy, you do taste the cheese, the black beans add a really good texture and a bit of a salty salivating left hook of flavor. Depending on if you have the jalapenos in the middle, bottom or top will determine when the heat and bite of the jalepeno come in but it's a great accent flavor to the bite. The pulled pork was more sweet than tangy for pulled pork which was a good compliment to the bite and heat of the jalapeno. The sides of guacamole, pico de galo, and sour cream are available if you'd like but it will make for a very messy chip if you try to get all three of those on top of what already usually comes on a chip.

The only "negative" I could come up with is a challenge that every order of nachos has...getting cheese on every chip. The chips on the bottom middle of the plate are always bare by the time I get to them. The struggle is real for the nachos out there...all the chips just aren't getting treated fairly. The ones on top get everything...but those on the bottom get nearly nothing besides the scraps the chips on top leave for them.

SUMMARY

Overall...the Upland Nachos at Upland Brewing Company Carmel Tap House are great for an individual or sharing with friends. Pair it with a nice craft beer of your choice and you've got great food, great drinks, great friends, and a great time!
Fun place with a great vibe. Doesn't hurt that I just received the best manicure and gel polish I've ever had. Awesome!

Thought it was just ok. Nothing special in my opinion. I don't recommend the mushroom soup. I thought it would have whole chunks of mushroom, but it was a whole pureed soup which was bland. Reminded me of baby food.

You know it's going to be a good latte, when you don't have to wait to let it cool down before you drink it.
When espresso is made at the right temperature, it has a beautiful, not bitter taste.
That's exactly what I got from this coffee shop when I ordered a latte.

Bad Monkey was a fun location with true diversity.  Many different types of locals and travelers of various ages enjoying a good draft beer or mixed up cocktail. 
The atmosphere had a miltary/airforce type of look and feel, helicopter hanging from ceiling to Ammunition style draft pours/decor.
Plenty of games like darts, billards and Jenga to help you spend the time while listening to live DJ playing 80's to current (2017) songs.
Not going to lie it was great to hear some of those fun 90s hits while sipping on my Jack Honey, while friends downed local pale ale drafts of Jai Alai.
Pricing was fair and good time was had by all. If in these parts again, would consider another stop for sure. 
*Also note upon 'checking in' they were nice enough to offer 10% off the bar tab.

We have come to this car wash several times in the past and was pleased with the service considering that the price was reasonable. Today on NYE we was surprised to see the prices have increased and the process has changed. We paid extra money $5 to have the dash, cupholders, console, and door panels cleaned. We ask for no tire shine. Today was not so good I'm not sure if the crew was just having a bad day. They put tire shine on and my husband asked them to wash it off. They apologized and attempted to wash off the tire shine and if you look at the pictures you can see it's not off and it looks horrible now. Once we started driving down the road, I noticed a whole bunch of spots on the outside of the window passenger side in my view. I also noticed a big white goo ball of stuff that they slathered on the dash and on some of the air conditioning vents. As I was wiping it off with a paper towel I noticed it was very unevenly applied some places had too much some places had none at all. I'm not trying to be mean everybody has bad days I would just recommend that you really eyeball and look over your vehicle before you leave.
Pizza is good. The pepperoni pizza isnt as greasy/oily as most places. It tastes pretty good to me. Delivery doesnt take too long either.

I have a feeling this place is a bit of a gimmick. There aren't a ton of seafood restaurants on the water, so it's wait here or eat without the water front view. There are only like 8 tables, so not a place for a big group. It's half outdoor seating too. Lots of specialty seafood like urchin and classic shrimps and fish. It was pretty tasty, and little pricey. Staff is kind of snippy, I think thats part of the "show".

The views are even more beautiful than I could have imagined. I was in town for business with a weekend free, and I had the courthouse on my list of things to do. I can see why so many couples choose to get married here!
There are elevators that go up to the top or you can take the stairs.

I love this place but has THE WORST experience yesterday. I have been here 3x and that's only because i live in New York. I usually have great experiences but I went to Candace yesterday and not only was her attitude sour, but she was SO harsh on my nails. Even though I said no, she buffed twice (why? I am only getting a regular manicure) and when she was filing my nails, I had to pull away because she was being so rough. I could SEE my nails bending. Terrible. She rolls her eyes constantly AND then when I told her there was a hair stuck in my polish, she rolled her eyes again and said no it was a bubble. No, I now have hairs in my nails. TWO of my nails have broken in less than 24 hours. My nails haven't even chipped in months. Terrible. She didn't give the back massage that accompanies the maní either. AVOID HER.

Had expectations for a fresh meal based on menu choices and advertising in the restaurant. The whole wheat roll for my chicken sandwich was both stale and rubbery at the same time- go figure. Sweet potato fries clearly had been rewarmed. My friend's salad was less pathetic but nothing special. This place is selling itself as fresh, healthy and from the farm.... yuck!

Very disappointed!!!! Made reservations early in week. When we arrived we were seated in bar area in the corner. It took an hour to get a glass of wine. 2 hours later our food arrived. Steak over cooked and all food was cold. Lobster was way over cooked (couldn't get out of shell). Food was compted but was not worth it. Bad service and bad food all in 1 visit.

Tried them twice , first time got lasagna and sent it back cause every bite was crunching cause it was over cocked , second time tried the pizza , and had to send it back as well , they do have have good cocktails to be fair

If you need a cute place to grab a drink and some food at the bar this is the place. It's very small for the kind of restaurant/bar it is so it's not ideal for large groups but a small group of 2-4 can be seated at one of their few tables. This also isn't a great place for people with any kind of hearing issues because it got quite loud on a Friday night when I stopped in with my mom after a movie. 

If it's just two of you (or you're solo) this is probably a great spot to have a conversation with someone you know well over some very interesting menu items. My mom loved her "Bee Charmer" cocktail with lavender-infused gin, honey, and a few other ingredients. She liked it so much she asked the bartender for the recipe but the key ingredient, the gin, takes two days to soak in lavender before it's drained and ready to be used. 

They have a decent beer selection but nothing particularly impressive. They have a few local brews from the area but this place is definitely known for its inventive cocktails.

We'll be back to try their famous burger but our appetizers of fried pickles (thick but crisp and fresh) and an adult version of pigs in blanket were tasty and worth ordering again although I liked the pickles more. Our visit was cut short for outside reasons but I would recommend this place for close friends, established couples or a couple of family members. It's moderately to expensively priced but something to try out for yourself if you're looking for something a little different.
I love Ruby! She always does my eyebrows nicely and is a nice person. Her studio is clean and elegant! Would not go anywhere else!

Yup, its gorgeous. This place is going to be the next darling of Fishtown. Tried a zatar labne flatbread and was really impressed with the texture. Had a pretty decent and certainly visually pleasing gingery cocktail. The place was already buzzing with people in its first week- when it opens with a full menu AND opens the courtyard, seats will be hard to come by.

We came here twice at the end of the year, the beignets were outstanding-prices seem good, however the music was gold! They had a band called "Steamboat Willie" playing every night till 12am, consisting of 5 older men, playing jazz. It was very nice to sit down and here NOLA jazz and have a snack. I warn you though that you should get there at least before 7pm because of limited seating.

Very nice korean bibimbap on the go. 
It's a small menu so it's great for people that wanna come and look at a simple menu in front of ur face and go.
I do like the japchae, but it was half the box. And do they mean by "vegetable" japchae because there wasn't any meat.
But in my opinion, you get what you pay for the beef bibimbap.
The vegetables and rice did not even fill up half of the height of the take out bento box. The marinated beef was good though.

I was full but it's not enough for a male tummy FYI.
I love this place...Colin and Sarah (ph) are the best and always friendly!!

I had an appointment for a Brazilian wax with Lori about a month ago. She did a great job! It was by far the least painful wax I've ever had, and I think it has a lot to do with her technique and the fact that she just chatted throughout the process so it didn't feel like a big deal. I wasn't planning to but I was so happy with my experience that I purchased the 5 waxes for $300 package, which saves you around $25 I believe.

expensive for what it is. I got the potatoes and sausage with a fried egg medium. the dish has onion, bell pepper, sausage, and potatoes. it didn't really taste like it was cooked together but rather it was pieced together. the sausage looked like cafeteria sausage. the egg was funny. REALLLLY runny. like the egg white was puddling down my potatoes into a pool.

They had coffee but it was burnt and they served in mugs which retained the heat like molten lava (perhaps so we would drink less?)
Absolutely amazing cheesesteak, atmosphere and milkshakes. If you are a cheesesteak lover, don't miss this
Excellent food, great friendly service. Big portions and tasty. I visit regularly and have left overs for lunch the next day.

Not authentic Korean. I ordered the Hwe Dup Bap - Sashimi yesterday and it was a bit basic. The fish was not plentiful but tasted ok. Unfortunately my stomach started convulsing after 10-15 minutes of eating this. It got really messy and I passed out on the bathroom floor in cold sweat for an hour. This happened only one other time for Philly restaurants and that place (Pho-ladelphia) was closed for sanitary reasons. Not saying this place wasn't fresh but just sayin'... mighty Fishy! Two stars instead of one since I'm giving Southgate the benefit of the doubt but I have no doubt in my mind I suffered food poisoning.

Let me start out by saying that the food was excellent though my main course of a fish stew was at best warm when delivered. The different courses were very tasty and even with the relatively small menu - there was enough variety that anyone should be able to find something that they would like. 

A restaurant experience relies not only on the food, but also the ambiance of the place and that is where Zeppoli is definitely lacking. The restaurant  is small and the tables are extremely close to one another and also relatively tiny. We felt like we were on top of the people near us. We had a party of six and the waitress had difficulty even trying to place food on the table without us having to either remove or shift our plates around. It is also pretty noisy. It was difficult to hold a conversation with a person across the table. The seats are also small, wooden and after 75 minutes we were all kind of shifting in the seats to find a comfortable way to sit. 

Again, the food was very good and the Italian donuts that we had for desert were absolutely worth the calories. Figure on spending approximately $60 per person (incl. tip) and without wine (BYOB). Overall, the experience though good was not the off the chart experience we had heard about.

Excellent food.   We ordered a wide variety from beef tacos, quesadillas, nachos and more for several people.   The guacamole was delicious!!  Deliver was a little slow, but worth the wait.  Will order again.

The ambiance is great! The drinks were tasty, the food, delicious! We had pressed rolls, pork belly, ribs, a few other appetizers and all of the items were enjoyed and devoured. Drinks, we had a few of their signature cocktails, I would recommend the cucumber geisha or The kraken! Go enjoy your evening at Seorak, you will thank me!

This place is usually ok and I find what I want. Not a good experience today. The people here were just plain rude. I was looking in the freezer department and one of the stockers wheeled up his cart right up to me, blocking my way. Unloaded two heavy boxes, almost on my foot. I had to jump out of the way. Looked at me, made some sort of grunting noise like it was my fault and promptly wheeled away. I also later, asked a lady where the ramen was and she grunted something, kept doing what she was doing until she was finished, then reluctantly took me over to where I might find them. I didn't get what I wanted because she had no idea what I was talking about and was rude about it. The only thing nice was the cashier was friendly. I might start taking my business to the one in st. Pete only.

This place is legit. The food is consistently delicious and even the vegetables are cooked to perfection. I live in Philly, where there are lots of Asian options - but I go out of my way for Asian Chef. The people that work there are awesome and super friendly, the fried foods are hot and crispy, and on top of that the prices are ridiculously reasonable. You can get a huge lunch for $7! Where else is that possible, I don't even know. Seriously, if I lived around here this would be my go to. People of Mount Laurel - don't take this for granted!!

I recently graduated from being a short sprinter in college in May and was looking for the perfect fitness facility to give me a hard cardio and resistance training workout. I also studied exercise science and therefore have a very picky attitude towards fitness facilities. However Barry's Boot Camp is the best around! The instructors are amazing and the workouts will kick your butt. Not to mention that the shower facilities are amazing and that there is a protein smoothie bar there as well. I'm extremely happy and pleased to be a member of Barrys Boot Camp and wish that everyone could give it a try. Antonio is amazing
Excellent food and live music.  I had the baked chicken and others had the burger and fried chicken. Food was great and a good selection of beverages.

What a hidden gem this place is!!! The owner is so sweet and wrapped up our purchase because we were giving it as a white elephant gift. 
She has a very unique selection and completely reasonable prices! Go check out and support this awesome small business!
Great food. Practically licked the bowls clean. Great service and inexpensive prices. I would recommend this to anyone. You will like it I promise just give it a shot.

First timer. Ordered their turkey chili which was great. Had flavor. Also ordered their turkey provolone panini which was the most unappealing in taste of any sandwich I have eaten out. The turkey had a gamey taste to it and the entire sandwich was hard to chew and bite off even. 
The price was more than I usually pay for lunch. Compared to other establishments in this neighborhood , not worth it. I will attach pictures of the sandwich. I only ate half. It was not worth the effort to chew. 
I wanted to like this place but it did not live up to the hype on the menu.
Best authentic Mexican food in the area! Quesadillas are a must try and the queso is perfection. If you're in the area, go here!

Saturday night was our first experience at Mangia. And it was an EXPERIENCE. So, we had no idea what "fall feast" entailed but it was epic. The food was excellent. We had wayyyyy too much tho. I think there were 9 rounds of food. There were 2 appetizers, 2 pastas, a salad, 2 rounds of meat, a vegetable platter, a dessert & a to go bag of Italian donuts.  #foodcoma 

The only thing I didn't enjoy was the LOUD environment, family style dinning. It's fun if you expect the loud atmosphere but not ideal when you imagined a nice romantic evening.  they dance and sing and enjoy life which is wonderful. A true escape of the real world. Literally felt like we were in a sitcom while we were there. We had no idea what was included, but it was very entertaining.  

Overall: recommend the place because the food is excellent and the chef is fun and loves people! Just don't expect a quiet dinning experience and you will love it

This place was pretty solid. It's not quite fast food but not really a restaurant. I had never been there before and the staff was super friendly to me. They gave me recommendations and they also give you a free sample if it's your first time. I ended up going with my own concoction which was a pulled chicken made super spicy. Everything was top notch and delicious. It was actually quite spicy especially with the gravy mixture they served with my sandwich I was dipping in. The potato salad was quite good as well as the fries. I sampled their seasonal sweet potato casserole which was solid as well. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick eat and especially if you like a good spicy pulled  meat sandwich.

Went here for lunch. Prompt and friendly service, food was very good and fresh. One person had the chicken gyro and two of us shared soup, salad, and 5 of the 8 traditional foods, all of which were delicious. Will definitely go back
Hidden in the Washington Square Mall! Amazing curry noodle soup. Will definitely be back! Must try!

Impressive collection of wine and spirits. Was looking for bitters and wow do they have an amazing selection for that as well. So knowledgeable and took the time to help me find what I was looking for. Definitely worth the trip north!

I ordered via Eat24 on Yelp for pick-up and it was very fast.  The food was good for American Chinese food and the quality was good as well.  I enjoyed the combination dinners and the portions were in line with other similar restaurants.  I would not recommend the hot and sour soup.  The General Tso's chicken and Beef with Garlic Sauce were both good.  Bubble tea was pretty good as well.  Solid choice for a quick and tasty meal.

This tour was amazing. Brian was entertaining, knowledgable, and filled to the brim with charm.
The stories we heard were chilling, and it was a great walking tour that unearthed some dark secrets of New Orleans. 
If you are into the paranormal and spiritual, this tour is a must.
Not just standard "ghost stories", this tour delves into architecture, religion, history, and has many fun put stops. 
Got recommended to this tour by friends, and I would definitely recommend to anyone!

Stopped here for lunch. It wasn't busy at all, so our food was made very quickly. 

This location is not at all like the other location I've visited in Tampa, but it is quite nice. The food came out hot and fresh.

Chateau Des Fleurs has a wonderful flow and view.  Especially when you go to have tea.  I have taken several teenage girls to the tea.  It has been a wonderful experience for them.  Some of them have never been to a tea and now it has opened their eyes to new experiences in life.  We had a wonderful time and the food and tea was on point.  It brought me right back to living in England.  I look forward to taking a new group of girls this year to experience what it is to have a proper tea.  It is well worth the money and time.

It was my first time eating here and it won't be my last! Had an early lunch on a Saturday and they were just starting to get busy. Waitress was friendly and extremely attentive to our needs. Food came out fast and hot. Cheesesteak egg rolls were delicious, even though $10 for 3 egg rolls seemed a bit overpriced. Wings were large and pork sandwich was really good. Only complaint is we were seated in the outdoor/covered patio. Great ambiance, but the sun started shining right in on us. Wish there were some kind of shades they could have pulled down.

I have found a new restaurant to add to my list. This place is off the hook. I ordered the Chicken Schwarma dinner plate. It was awesome. The prices were very reasonable and the portions are big. Be prepared to either bring your appetite or ask for a to go box. There is enough food for two meals. I will be returning.

Excellent freshly cooked food. My chicken tacos, with avocado added, were perfect.  My husbands regular sized burrito was huge and delicious.  Great stop after buying Florida citrus across the street.

I went to the salon to get a Brazilian Wax + Stomach Strip and boy was this a pitch job and messy. My Waxer was Rebekah. She was very pleased to to talk to but she was just not careful. She didn't do small sections like the other waxers, instead she did huge sections. I had Wax all over me. Just strings all over my stomach. EVERYWHERE. I had to peel it off and hand it to her. Overall she is nice however, if I can save someone their money I would 100% not recommend for a Brazilian Wax. I usually just bounce around and take any waxer I can get but this was just horrible. I've gone there every month since Feb and I needed to say something about this one because it was horrible.

I highly recommend the edge salon and barbershop. The proprietor Xanthia has a sharp eye for detail. And you can't beat the price. My former hairstylist has 30 years experience and I'm proud to say I've alway leave satisfied when you style my hair!  Yes originally this was a five star review. What brought it down to two star review it's unprofessional for a business owner that was told something private in her shop and agreed that it will be confidential and unfortunately did not keep it confidential.  As for haircuts yes this is the place to go, when finished you will walk out with confidence that your hairstyle Is flawless.
A small place with quick, delicious comfort food. Lots of rice, pick your toppings, add your own sauces. Big portions, but they come in take-away bowls for finishing at home - just ask for a lid.

The food is good but be warned. If you would like to have a conversation inside Timpano don't go for lunch on Sunday. A singer/guitarist was performing WAY TOO LOUD. We kindly asked (more than once) for the volume on the amps to be lowered. But they were not. Since we came to eat and talk with friends, and not attend a concert, we had to leave the place and find another nearby restaurant. In this case, we were very happy with the Wine Exchange and Bistro. Great food and quiet. If Timpano is a must, and you want to talk, make sure you get an outdoor table. The traffic won't be as loud as the singer.

I loved this place!  As a traditional green witch herbalist myself the herb infused oils were my favorite. The man making them up in the back is second or third generation to voodoo. Cute shop and I got some nice gifts for friends.

I've only been in Hendersonville for 3 weeks. I was ready to get my 4th tattoo but didn't know anything about any of the places here. I did my research and Evolutionary had two things I was looking for, the individual rooms for privacy and excellent reviews. Cayla did my tattoo, she took my idea and mish-mash of things I wanted and put them into a solid piece. I couldn't be more happy and we already talked about the design for my next beautiful piece.

Don't stay here! My gf brought home bedbugs from this nasty place. She had to pay big money to treat her home for the bedbugs she got at sandy land reef inn. Se also had to see a doctor and get medication to help her skin. She is now permanently scared from this infestation. Luckily I walked away with no issues. It was loud and the people who worked there were....odd, to say the least.

I had planned to bring my bracelet and watches to Hayman while visiting Tampa. Hurricane Irma prevented that from happening. So, I made sure that I brought my items when I returned this month. Mr. Thornton was very helpful (even letting me know that certain pieces attached to my bracelet were not gold).  Now I know who I can trust with my repairs.  I left my items with Hayman, returned home and a few days later, my bracelet and watch arrived in perfect condition. I am very pleased with the service that Hayman has provided to me.

Came here for brunch and wasn't disappointed. Plenty of options, even gluten-free. I had the vegetable buckwheat and egg crepe, which was delicious and hearty. They offer fresh squeezed juices, smoothies, and alcoholic breakfast beverages. 

The space is small but they fit a good amount of tables plus the dozen seats at the bar. Service is friendly. The kitchen is clean, which I saw from my seat at the bar.
Always friendly and helpful and carry a huge selection for a small shop. Great location.

This diner is down the street from my job, so I typically eat here a couple of times a month. I usually go when I'm craving breakfast for lunch.  My standard orders are the diner classic cream chipped beef, which is yummy every time and served in a huge portion, or the peanut butter chip pancakes, which are also tasty but sometimes come out a little raw in the middle. 

The service I've gotten here over the last few years has been all over the board, from warm and friendly, to taking longer than my full lunch hour on a not busy day to serve me (a single diner!) a meal and get my check.  It tends to be serviceable more often than not, though, so the flukes don't deter me from coming. 

I've had some bad luck with desserts here.  They look really good in the case, but I have gotten stale, dry cake on a couple of occasions and once, worst of all, a chocolate cream pie with some kind of serving paper stuck to the bottom of it that just wouldn't come off.   The lemon meringue pie is good. 

Generally I'm pretty happy going to the Golden Eagle, knowing I'm going to get a satisfying diner breakfast.   I've heard other people complain to managers about their food not being what they expected or being too salty while I've been there, and it really doesn't sway me.  It's not fancy and it's not fine dining, or perfect every time, but I still like it.

Probably the worst casino in the nation. No free drinks when you sit at the tables, I was playing at a table for almost 2 hours, I was down a lot and asked for comps to use for a drink. They took my card and came back after 20 minutes just to tell me I couldn't get anything and to try again in an hour. Long lines at the cashier on weekends, and bad service. I wish there was another casino on this area.

I placed a delivery order for chicken chow mein, broccoli with garlic sauce, and chicken with garlic sauce. They only sent ONE correct order to us, the chicken with garlic sauce. The other two orders were beef with garlic sauce and chicken and cabbage with no noodles. When I called back to ask if they could resend the order and I would give them the incorrect orders back, she yelled and stated that chicken chow mein DOES NOT include noodles, only lo mein does. I'm not Chinese, but I'm pretty sure that "chow mein" translates to "fried noodles." I would recommend never ordering from this restaurant if you want a correct order.. or chow mein WITH noodles. They said the only way they would correct the order was if we brought it back to them.. which doesn't make sense because we ordered delivery and they messed up. The only good thing was how quickly we received the incorrect order.

I worked for the Service Manager many years ago at their Toyota store. He used to call me "youngster." Great manager who taught me a lot about life. I was talking to a friend, who also was an advisor and the one who introduced me to the manager, and I was reflecting on how the current Service Manager was the most honest manager I ever worked for. I can guarantee you that if you go to Conicelli for service, you will be given a fair and honest price.

Excellent food. 

The place wasn't  as clean as one should expect. Every table had crumbles and left overs. Had to engage two staff members to do the job right since the first one  couldn't do nuts. 
Thank you staff member #2 who was apparently on her break but still did the job and in the right way and spirit 

Excellent food is a combination of great prep + clean ambiance + friendly staff

Two stars because the food is good. They lost three stars because the delivery guy is a greedy, entitled bastard who begged for a tip and refused to leave our doorstep, claiming he works off of tips. Yeah okay buddy. I refuse to believe that the restaurant isn't paying this dude for delivering food. When restaurants have delivery fees that usually goes toward the driver. Well that's not true for this restaurant. When I called there to complain the woman who answered the phone told me that the delivery fee goes to the restaurant. Sheisty af. I may order pick up from them again but for someone to complain about not getting tipped for driving less than a mile down the street (literally) makes me question the integrity of Pikpon Thai.
Always a treat, drinks, service and food tops. Trip is the best leader since they opened. He's hands on and very professional make it feel like a private high end club.

South Grand has many delicious good offerings; currently, my brother and I are trying as many as we can. This particular place was the next on our list. The restaurant was inviting but only a few tables were occupied on what should have been a busy Friday night. After dining there, my guess is because the service is not the best. It took a bit for someone to come over and take our drink order by the time they did, we were ready to order our food from an extensive menu. The menu has many great offerings for those who are vegetarian or love seafood along with other meat options as well. We tried the Shrimp spring rolls which were excellent. You get five of them for about $6 and it is the perfect amount for an appetizer. Our main meal arrived and it was delicious as well, though it was not quite enough to eat for my brother. He ordered one of the seafood items while I went for a vegetarian option. I ordered a Pad Sun Wen which was a perfect amount for me; I even took some home. The Thai iced tea is also delicious and was my favorite part of the whole trip. We never were asked if we wanted refills and the only time someone came by, was to drop off our food, drinks or the check. I did observe that this place seemed to do a lot of carry out and perhaps that is the way to go.

The Dan Dan Noodles delivered: perfectly textured noodles dunked in a spicy/sweet/savory chili oil. There's a tiny dollop of ground pork present.
Scallion Pancakes: fine. The dipping sauce is spicy oil. Naturally.
Thrice-fried chicken: tiny bite-sized spicy white-peppery nuggets lost in a pile of hot chilies that I didn't really have the guts to eat. Comes with a side of steamed rice, which is essential to survive eating in this joint, where everything is spicy. 
Coming from the Manhattan branches of Han Dynasty, this giant restaurant is a welcome change!

Stopped in while on vacation and really glad I did. With so many great choices to eat this is a must visit! Had the shrimp and fish poboy and the seafood gumbo. Both had great flavor and very good portions. Very spacious and we were sat immediately, even though the place was packed. Great drinks as well! Was not disappointed and definitely worth another visit!

Had a good time with friends catching up before the holidays. Tthe food was decent. The drink that I had which was the Santa Rita was a bit salty due to the wine. I ordered it with the naked rim, meaning no salt or sugar on the rim of the glass. 
The server we had was nice and very expedient she had  10 different orders to keep up with and was very successful at it. I noticed that The restaurant will automatically add a a gratuity okn each bill for party's of 6 or more. 
Over all not a bad experience. If ever in that area I would visit again.

Jonathan Plasky was a fantastic salesman. We got a great deal and he was very communicative throughout the process as we arranged to get the car. We drove an hour to their dealership and were not disappointed. Everyone was so nice. He spent time going over all of the car features in great detail. No high pressure sales or games. I am very happy with my experience. I will definitely return here the next time we buy a car (I love Hondas). Check out Crown Honda. It's worth the drive!

Thanks 
Best and the best around to USF. hi recommendation for this place. Professional people from the owner of the bar tend to the waiter. I have this girl she super sweet and kind and so helping.

Stopped in here on a Friday awhile back. No one acknowledged me when walked into the store for a good 5 minutes. Finally the assistant manager came over to talk to me. I told him what I was looking for new wheels/tires for my Jeep. He said that the bolt pattern is rare (people change their wheels/tires on Jeeps all the time, so don't know what that was about), but said he could find me some wheels to fit. He also gave me some false information regarding the size of the wheels, saying I couldn't go with a certain size of rim, even though I know people with the same Jeep that have that size rim. Anyway, he took my number down & a few rim styles that I liked, & said he would call me back the following Monday after checking with the warehouse. He never called back. I finally called almost a month later, & he gave me three different rim style numbers & said to look them up on Google & see if I liked them. I did, but they were none of the styles I had looked at in the store. I called him back to tell him which one I liked since we hadn't even talked a price yet. I had told him I was on a budget, & wanted to stay under a certain price, preferably. He came back with a ridiculous price point that was way above what I said I wanted to spend, with no options for anything cheaper at all. Maybe the other RNR locations besides Fletcher are different. but I definitely will be looking elsewhere for rims/tires. I know this place is supposed to help people with poor credit, but they are really screwing people over if that's the service & prices they are offering.

I was excited for another place to open up on Harbor Island and couldn't wait to try American Social after hearing some rave reviews around town.  We decided to come in the early afternoon to have some drinks and food before the Lady Gaga concert on a recent Friday.  Upon arriving, since we were early, it was pretty easy to get a table outside but the place got pretty packed around 6pm with fellow concert goers and the after work happy hour crowd.

Cocktails off their menu are very creative and sound tasty, but two cocktails can set you back about $30.  There is a weekday happy hour for apps and the pretzel bites off that menu were a bit of a disappointment.  They tasted like clumps of bread with large salt chunks on them.  It was served with a cherry mustard, which was an odd combo.  I ended up also having a quesadilla off the menu and it was dried out and felt as if it was prepared earlier in the day and just sat all day under a heat lamp.  The pricing of the food was also not indicative of the quality and overpriced in my opinion.  

It was nice seeing this location finally fill up with another tenant and the overall atmosphere is really nice and spacious, but I feel as if their food quality needs to improve if they want to charge the prices they do.
I ordered from here a while back with Uber Eats and what I had delivered was horrible a stack of soggy chips for my nachos. I wrote them and never heard back. Horrible customer service.

Since my wife became vegan we've been waiting for this place to open! Everything we've had has been tasty and flavorful, we had the seitenderloin, buffalo Mac, and fried polenta...so good. Plan to make this place a weekly date night.

The food is pretty good, but it isn't special enough to warrant waiting in line for more than just a few minutes. My issue is that my $3 tip on an $11.78 bill somehow turned into an $8 tip on my credit card statement. Management has not been available when I call. The automated message directs me to voicemail, which I have used and have received no response. Save yourself from theft and either use cash or find some place else.

We were staying at the Royal Sonesta for last several days, and have been going to our regular restaurants, but today on our last day, we decided to try the Desire Oyster bar.  We got grilled oysters and fried shrimp/oyster combo and they were both outstanding.  The grilled oysters were plump and juicy and had a nice mix of Parmesan, garlic and butter.  The fried combo was great as well. Even the French fries were cooked and seasoned well.

As a Greek looking for a nice restaurant in Philly, I stumbled upon Zorba's which was excellent!! The food was spot on, and reminded me of the food I grew up with. The service was wonderful and the food was amazing. We came in on a busy Saturday night and were seated right away and taken care of all night!!

This bar is more depressing than the Eagles SNF effort against Seattle. All the employees seem like the type of people who use an umbrella in a light drizzle, but Roger was an especially sensitive specimen. The beer list was unimpressive and overall there are much better places to drink in Philly such as under the bridge with Duncan and his crew.
The aesthetics of the place is amazing and the food is pretty bomb too. I love it, I would highly recommend

Super yummy macarons! My favorite was the vietnamese coffee! I would love to try other flavors such as green tea, lavender, and earl grey! But I'm aware their macarons are made randomly. I have to say the macarons here are better than la bonne bouchee I can eat more than one macaron here without having a belly ache. Usually when I am working on my second macaron at la bonne bouchee, my belly is hurting, thinking I'm just consuming too much sweets lol. My nephew had a cake made here which was the artwork was amazing!! The kids in the family killed all the fondant. I wasn't a fan of the cake, it was too sweet for my liking and that's just the cake itself with no fondant. I'm up to try their other pastries next time!

We had a Noritz N-084M with an error 98- which is a combustion error- basically Gas of Fan issues; this is a large Tankless rated for 5+ bathroom homes.  While i'm a high functioning DIY'r- these types of repairs (involving Gas) are best left to Plumbers.  My experience with most Electricians and Plumbers over the last 10 years has not been good- ridiculous pricing reflecting a disconnect from reality and common sense- AND most are so incompetent- one plumber quoted $400 to replace a pressure reduction valve- a $20 part and a 15 min repair.

Now we had a pretty good idea of what the repair would be- which most plumbers don't like - but the Lee Technician that showed up- John (their tankless guy) was great.  

Low key but very knowledgable- which makes you forgive his lack of responsiveness with respect to time; he was about 3 hours late ;)-  but actually that gave us time (my tenant and i) to pull apart the unit and start in on some of the work- he showed up- took a look at what we had done (made sure we didn't make any egregious errors)- he took over and finished up- spotted a small leak that had caused corrosion in one of the electrical harnesses.  He cut the harness and direct wired it. 

His work was excellent, his demeanor should be a training video for all in home subcontract technicians (great ability to read the room), he was respectful and informative and a general pleasure to be around- the entire visit was probably around 3 hours- although, i left after about 90 min.  He let himself out and my tenants didn't even know that he had left.

I got the bill a couple of days later and thought it was very reasonable- in-fact - he probably under charged and over delivered....  how often do you hear that !

we've built several homes over the years and are not the typical call for most of these types of contractors- i have been reticent to call a company the size of Lee- as it is hard to maintain quality when a company grows past a certain head count- my hats off to Lee- we will definitely put them at the top of our call list when we do our next reno in the spring

thanks so much !!
Super fresh! They made me spicy crab for me, which was awesome! We will so be going back!

Good food and great beer. Personally, more sours and saisons than I like. We tried to fill up a couple growlers but they refused and said we had to buy their glass growler or trade ours (stainless steel vacuum insulated growler) in for their glass growlers.  

After expressing our frustration at the options we concluded it wasn't worth it and decided to find some other beer that was truly worthy of our growlers.

Tl;Dr pretty good beer, but a little snooty

Our Taco Tuesday was brought to you by Bistro Habenero.
We had:
Carne Asada tacos with a chipotle crema
Grilled shrimp tacos
El Salvadoran Pork Tamales 
Cheese Papusas
The service is always polite and attentive.
As always we had a great meal! 
The only thing that kept it from being 5 stars was the asada was a bit dry.

Absolutely love my sns nails done by Fin! If you are looking for an affordable and very precise nail service I would highly recommend Brilliant! She took her time and made sure that the color went right to the cuticle. She also added an extra coat on the tips of my nails as I am pretty rough on them. 

Such a great experience!

The Hollander Hotel was an all around great experience for my family and I.  I was going to say that their outstanding level of hospitality began with our arrival, but now I realize it was earlier.  It began with making and changing my reservations months earlier.  Changes were made promptly and competently and cheerfully.  Upon our arrival we were greeted warmly and checked in quickly.  The hotel is clean.  The atmosphere during our holiday stay was nothing short of an old time movie with the decor was festive and elegant.  And although the entire staff was working on xmas day (the front desk, cleaning staff, wait staff  at the bar and restaurant) all were lighthearted and joyful.  The food at the restaurant is good and fairly priced.  New towels and soap were provided each day without fail.  Checkout was a breeze.  Lastly, when we arrived home my daughter left her iPad in her room. We called and within 20 minutes the iPad was located and arrangements were made for its return.  I highly recommend a stay at the Hollander Hotel.
Tabby was a great waitress her service was second to none and the Manager Steve as well! Thanks

Solid neighborhood place.

Walking in is a cool experience. It's cozy but cool - they have an awesome ceiling mural that brings a modern vibe.

We were greeted and seated quickly. Our server was friendly and helpful.

To start with my friend and I ordered Cafe Salads @ $6 - romaine, cherry tomato, black olive, red onion, and mozzarella tossed with house red wine vinaigrette dressing. 

The salad was fresh and flavorful which was delightful.

For our entrees we all ordered pizza.

Traditional Sicilian @ $13
Sicilian pizza sauce, zesty tomato, oregano, & mozzarella with a thick crust baked in olive oil.

We all tried this one and enjoyed the zesty tomatoes and chewy crust.

Mama's Meatball @ $14
Pecorino encrusted hand rolled meatballs & fresh parsley.

I did not try this one but my friend reported it to be good.

Margherita @ $13
Fresh mozzarella, cherry tomato & fresh leaf basil.

This one was a bit disappointing to me. It had way more cheese than I was expecting and lacked in basil, tomato, and flavor. I thought the cheese would be more like fresh mozzarella balls scattered sparingly.

For dessert my 2 friends had cannoli (one to go) and I tried the lemon sorbetto.

The friend that ate the cannoli said it was good.

My lemon sorbetto was just weird. The flavor was inconsistent. Some was very syrupy/lemony, some was flavorless, and some tasted like overly sweet vanilla frosting. The texture was kind of grainy.

I will mos def pop back in at some point but it won't be a go to. Definitely worth checking out.

The service was great and so was the food. The portions were just right and everything we ate was great. I had the meatloaf with mac and cheese and my husband has the catfish with fries and green beans. The meatloaf was seasoned just right with noting too over powerful in it and the catfish batter was cornmeal base that was light and flavorful. We will be back.

Go here occasionally and they are normally pretty good. Today I bought two white cream filled chocolate donuts and both donuts weren't very filled with cream like they normally are. Was very disappointed in the lack of cream. Other than that they were very fresh donuts. The employees were very patient with us while trying to decide what to get. Although digital menu was a little confusing.

Honored to have visited this church today to see the Indianapolis Children's Choir perform "White Christmas". I honestly had never noticed this church despite driving past it several times along 86th Street near Meridian en route to Trader Joe's. The church has a clean design with a brick exterior and some stunning peaceful areas thanks to a garden and skylight corridor. The main sanctuary features an upper level and gorgeous stained glass windows that allow the natural light to flood in to the stage. The sanctuary is fairly large which explains why the ICC would choose this location. Note that they also offer ample parking. I can't speak for the church services but it did appear that they offer five services during Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The upper level of the sanctuary offers a beautiful view of the entire room.

I love the Starbucks in my neighbourhood. The are super friendly and the store is always clean. Coffee is great, you cam veganize your drink which is awesome. The only bad thing here is the lack on vegan food. They only offer a bagel with avocado spread (which is way too spicy) and a platter they never ever have. I hope they realize this and get
More savoury stuff for all the vegans in town.

Tonight my husband and I brought a friend in for dinner. We arrived at 9pm looked at the menu for a few minutes and then ordered a pizza, appetizer, and a few drinks. Our drinks came midway through eating the appetizer. We actually just assumed they weren't coming. A few bites into our pizza we decided to order another of the same because it was so good and everyone was starving. The waitress came around collected our plates and silverware....then dropped off our pizza in a to go box. We told her we planned to eat it now & she responded, "Well, we close at 10."  It was 9:50. I understand everyone wants to leave, but after spending almost $100 I thought it would be acceptable to stay at least until 10. I have been in the event/hospitality industry for 15 years and I have never been made to feel so uncomfortable and awkward. I would never complain about service if the restaurant was packed and understaffed, but we were 3 of 5 customers and there was no excuse for such poor service. There are way too many other good choices in our neighborhood for us to come back.

One word. Cockroaches.  We woke up in the morning to find a giant cockroach on the wall of our room.  It forced us to leave the hotel much earlier than we had planned.  The hotel would only give us HALF of our money back after this horrific experience.  When I explained to the front desk that we had a cockroach the room and are leaving because of it, the front desk staff said they would be able to refund our room.  However when it came time for Expedia (who we booked the room through) to contact the hotel to approve of the refund, The Quality Inn said they could only refund half.  

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at, and very disappointed with the customer service.

This a review of the kids haircut. Both my little guys needed a haircut and this place was recommended by a friend of ours. 

If you're not familiar with this place, it is a sports oriented haircut establishment. A TV showing ESPN or a sporting event. Sports magazines on the rack for your reading pleasure. The process of getting a haircut is to check in on the tablet. Type in your number if you've already registered and wait. You can also request a certain stylist if you wanted.

We didn't have to wait long and there is about 16 chairs you can sit on. The stylist was very professional and made our kids feel comfortable. There were lollipops to help them pass the time too. Since it was our first time there, they upgraded the cut to the MVP.  Your kids will get a shampoo , dry, and a massage if needed. They also have hair color which my kids wanted. Blue for one and red for the other.

The haircut was good. My kids were happy and the staff was great. We will be back again.  

The Kids MVP cut is 23 dollars.

Ok so we finally made it to the Wesley Chapel location! The bar service was excellent! the food was good! The service was...stupid!
I don't mid paying 20.00 for fried chicken or scallops or pizza but when you take 35 minutes to serve 3 people at 9:30pm when the restaurant was down to 15 guest and 7 people in the kitchen, is not acceptable. My wife has never had Frangelico and coffee so I decided to order her one, epic fail! Coffee was stale to the point of overwhelming the Frangelico! Sad! And when I pointed it out to the manager who said I'll make a fresh pot, well I guess he did but forgot to serve it? So waitress #3 finally showed up with the coffee and Frangelico 45 minutes later we could careless at that point!
If you want to make it in the restaurant business service is everything! Your people need to be better trained and have there head in the game until closing not before but all the way to the end! You can deduct all of the items you want from a bill but if your service and food doesn't cut it your doomed!
We will give you a second chance but lets get it together and make it a goto restaurant in Wesley Chapel

Another brunch gem for Midtown! We went here to try a local place before we headed home and we were not disappointed! We started out with the White Trash Hash- holy smokes. They're basically cheesy potatoes but way better. I had the Pretzel Pancakes for my meal and they were the perfect flavor. They were drizzled with dulce de leche and served with a side of white chocolate mousse and they were so good! I also had a side of Texas toast (hello carb day). Ask for the coconut jam with it... UNREAL. My boyfriend had the biscuits with chorizo gravy and he said they were really good. He also asked for a hot chocolate. Our server (I can't remember what her name was but we were in the room that looks out onto the patio on Sunday 12/17) went to the back to check if they had it and it turns out she made it by heating up milk and melting chocolate.. they didn't have packets so she went above and beyond. Incredible food, incredible service, and definitely one of our new regular spots when we visit!

Walking into Burger Study was reminiscent of a Harvard Law Library. Dim lighting, rich woods, and a bit of a cozy feel. Not what I would typically expect from a burger spot, but hey- it works! Perhaps what sets this spot apart from other burger spots in the city. 

I think Burger Study also finally hit their stride. When they first opened there wasn't a ton of consistency among their dishes, but I recently returned and was pleasantly surprised. Burgers were cooked to perfection and topped with only the highest  quality ingredients. My fiancé pointed out that this was the best bacon he had ever had on a burger! 

A great alternative to some of the other chains along GA Street and a must try for any out of towners.
Hands down best drivers in town. Other places can't get a pizza to me in less that an hour!

Had the Shrimp and Lobster  Fettuccine which was delicious! They gave me a HUGE portion so I had leftovers for lunch the next day. Also, our waitress, Gaelen was excellent! Superb food, service, and atmosphere! Perfect location for your Christmas Celebrations...there were over 40 in our group and we still received exceptional service. Will definitely be back soon.
We have been going here for two years. Love the burgers and the piadinis. Great place for take out when you don't want to cook.
We had sweet and sour chicken @ peppersteak last night. It was a bit pricey but very good. The meat was tender and the rice excellent. I'll definitely order again in the near future!

First, we almost gave up due to no parking. Finally, the parking gods came around. We were the only customers in the restaurant. Split the cheese curds which were great. Now for the meatball sandwich. Terrible. Meat, cheese, and bread. Nothing else. It was dry, only warm, and not even remotely "pressed". Salad was great, loved the dressing. I would try this place again with all of the good reviews but was very underwhelmed. Could've been that they were focusing most of their time on Uber orders and take out.

Oh man, where to start! The Garden Brunch Cafe is in an adorable house, with diverse art placed in each room. The service was wonderful and attentive. We had coffee, fruit tea, a salmon Benedict, and the bananas foster pancakes. Everything was superb! My husband couldn't stop talking about the coffee, and I always enjoy southern fruit tea. The salmon Benedict was comparable to any good Benedict dish, but the real star of the show was the pancakes. I'm neither a pancake person nor a banana person but we ordered this on the recommendation of a friend. I am so glad we did! The serving was huge, and I think just splitting the pancakes alone between two people would have been plenty. They were delicious! The best specialty pancakes I've ever had, for sure. We will be coming back, and bringing friends!

Wife and I tend to go out to eat a lot.  Don't write many reviews, but thought I'd mention one of my favorite places to have breakfast.  Mind you the food is good, but difficult to say it's exceptional.  An egg is an egg right?  However, I'd like to point out the service is what separates this place from others. In particular, Mindy and 
Kaitlynn have been exceptional servers every time we've been here.  I'm sure there are others, but I'm unable to recollect their names.  Never been displeased with the food and the service makes this place one of my favorites.

Food was very well prepared here...the only reason they are getting two stars.  The service SUCKED. So slow. Server would ask as walking by if anything was needed but not stop to hear the answer. Ordered beer and waited for it while the server rolled silverware. Place offer a $1 off beer when train goes by but when they did go by it seemed every server and bartender hid behind the bar doing side work. Beer was ok. Go to untapped for reviews on that. On a positive side, the Reuben sandwich was excellent. Recommend the beer battered fries.

I was excited to eat at Timpano. We were seated outside which has nice ambience, the only good part of the restaurant. I ordered the steak and broccoli. The steak which I ordered medium came out cold and was well done. Not to mention for a $29 steak the portion was very small with no add ons without paying extra. I ordered a side of broccoli for $10 expecting the best due to the price of a side only getting stalks that had no taste and barely resembled broccoli. The service was also sub par for what you expect at a fancy place like this. Will not go back, waste of money I could make better food at home.
Probably the best ice cream ever. Try the salty smokey chocolate almond. Seriously good stuff.

First time to eat at this small quaint establishment. Ate here for breakfast and had the make your own omelette with shrimp,crab, spinach and mushroom. My husband had the seafood omelette, kids had the cinnamon and vanilla pancakes with strawberry, and a egg, potatoes and sausage platter. Very good food; best grits we've tasted. I gave this place 4 stars coz the crab meat in my omelette was lacking. I tasted more shrimp than the crab.
Dr. Maria is so caring--she really took time to explain everything to me. If you have any foot problems, this is the place!

We were spending the night in Reno and wanted to try Chick-fil-A. I don't know if it was just this drive in but our chicken sandwiches were not very good. 

However the milkshakes were good.

Don't know if we will try it again.
My mom, daughter and I stumbled across this place and we loved it!! Everything was great!! Great sandwiches, soups and salads.  Homemade breads and desserts!! We will be back!

Well it was snowing and we needed somewhere close so we went here for dinner. I really want to like this place because it is close to home. We have been here before and we're kind of non committal as to wether it meets the mark.  We decided to sit and eat at the bar. The good---the drinks were adult poured and very good. The bad The menu is very lacking in small plates and apps. The bar space is not planned very well and not real comfortable. A little music please? Dull would be the word to describe the atmosphere and the food choices. 
We will come back in a pinch, but the Yardly Inn is much much better.

Trendy, industrial decor in a small space with a good number of tables but if the word has gotten out this place must get packed.  We went for lunch and based on the waiter's recommendation, ordered the Char Sui Pork Ribs.  They were amazing!!!  Fall-off-the-bone tender, delicious sauce, a cilantro and mint salad to top, and a sweet/salty peanut crumble.  It it not something I would usually order but SO glad I did.  The Juicy Lucy lamb burger was good but I have had better lamb burgers--it was juicy, wasn't greasy, but just missing something maybe.  I'm definitely going back to check out dinner!

The food was absolutely amazing, but the service was very slow and I don't think the waitress really liked her job. After we ordered our drinks we didn't get them for 15 minutes which at that point they were watered down. That is the reason for 4 stars. But everything else was on point.
Always a positive experience here, staff are welcoming and courteous. I wish they had this type of customer service other places!

I had been avoiding this place for a while, but now I regret it! Don't know why but I had a misconception. Went here before a Roadrunners game at the TCC and had great food and great beer. Quick service was great, considering it was pretty busy! And the free chips and salsa (with warmed chips!) were a nice touch.

Unfortunately I don't live in St. Louis anymore but I've wanted to support this establishment for a while. Took my mom here and we had a fantastic server (his name escapes me), Connor maybe. Anyhoo, he helped us pick a couple of pies and they were amazing. I had the barbecue chicken and my mom had the specialty sausage pizza. Both were excellent. I ordered gluten free crust which, if not done correctly, can be a turn off. This fasted like cornbread. I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in town.

Being that poke is my favorite food group, I am ecstatic that this place exists within 5 minutes of my home. So delicious and fresh and quick! The drive through factor is just a bonus. Please everyone support them!!

Jones is a hip 'comfort food' bistro/bar open for lunch and dinner 'til 11:00 PM.
