Since it was my first time at the hotel and it was their error, I asked if there was a comp- 1 front desk person and 2 supervisors later I was able to get 1 free drink at the bar for a house brand drink. Really? All that work for a $4 glass of wine? When my daughter's cold got worse and then she couldn't use the additional service I just paid for, neither the hotel or the spa would work with us to rebook the service, issue a gift certificate or anything else. The room was ok, nothing special. The hot tub and pool were ok, but creepy later in the evening due to poor lighting and minimal staff. Save yourself money and stay some other place that is more customer oriented.

Had a grilled chicken sandwich on bun to go. Couldn't hold sandwich due to bottom bun being soggy.  So I decided to just eat the meat.  I saw a piece of hair as I removed the meat. I haven't ate there in years and will not eat there again.  Zero stars from me.
This was an amazing restaurant. Our server Doug was very accommodating and professional. We were hungry so no time to take pictures LOL

The customer service was horrible. I called to place an order for pick up. The kids menu was not posted online so I asked the lady who answered for the kids menu. She proceeded to tell me that she was too busy to tell me and placed me on hold. However, she didn't realize that I could still hear her. She proceeded to complain that someone was on the phone asking her to read the entire menu and she didn't have time. I told her to cancel the order and I drove up there. When I got there and asked to speak to a manager, I discovered that the person who answered the phone was the manager. I have never experienced such rude and unprofessional customer service. RUDE RUDE RUDE!

At one point in time, The Foodery was the ONLY place to go for mixed six-packs of good quality craft beer. The times, however, have changed rapidly. The Foodery has not!

This Foodery still hasn't decided whether it wants to be a bodega or a bottle shop, which in a store that small means that there's not a lot of room to walk around. Once you get more than 5 people in the store, you're literally pressed up against each other as you try to open the fridge doors. If you go before 4pm, you'll have room to shop, but the staff the works during the day don't know shit about beer, including one woman who doesn't drink beer at all. The night time staff is more on the ball.

There are literally dozens of other bottle shops now that have better selection and lower prices (Beer Heaven, Beer Love, the Bottle Shop, Pennsport Beer Boutique, the Beer Peddlers, etc.), so it's not worth it to pay the extra $5-$10 per bottle unless you're really, really lazy. It's especially galling when you consider that they own their own beer distributor, Global, but are still overcharging you.

I am embarrassed at how many times I have walked by this little boutique and haven't walked in to shop. Thank goodness, I discovered them at their outside booth during the Lafayette Holiday House tour. 

My cousin and are the family shoppers and after browsing the items at the outdoor booth, we headed up the street to check out the store. We weren't the only ones with this brilliant idea, the store was packed. After finding several gifts for different people on our Santa list, we opted to return later to make our purchases and avoid the crowd. 

Without giving away details, because a recipient may be reading this review. We found several unique and STL themed gifts for local sports fans and bar items for the boozers. We do not discriminate, we shop for the naughty and nice. 

The staff was friendly and very helpful with our selections. This little shop will now be one of my go to stores for unique gifts and I'll be shopping local. 

Will I return? - YES!

When: December 10, 2017
Why: Naughty or Nice List
If u need a little history on IPA etc. Frank is your guy! Great food & one of the largest variety of cold brews I've ever seen in a local spot.
Free beach parking if you can grab a spot. Bartenders are good and food as well. Great sunsets.

We were slow to try Pica's....our loss. Quality is outstanding, portions generous. Grilled chicken Alfredo, chicken Parmesan sandwich and seared scallops. Yum, yum and yum! Warm bread and sautéed peppers to table at start. Reasonable pricing for quality food! We'll be back. And, staff is friendly and professional. An all around win.

Exquisite. We went here for the second time this fall since they started the chef's menu. We'd been to Vetri a few times in the past, when it was a fabulous, traditional Italian restaurant and it was great then. This is food, wine and service taken to a new level. On both occasions we had the wine pairing and it was spot on perfect with the courses. We started both times with a palate teaser from the chef which promised the joys of what was to come. Unlike most multi course chef's offerings (such as Alinea in Chicago) Vetri actually gives you a choice of dishes within a limited range of beautifully prepared courses. We opted to have the chef choose for us both times so that we could taste what he thought was interesting and so that we could share each other's plates. When I say that this rivals the best restaurants that I've ever been to, it is not an exaggeration. The blend of flavors in each course and plate was magnificent.
In addition, we had the same wait person both times and he paid meticulous attention to us and was friendly and understated. Such a pleasure. Finally, one could actually have a lovely conversation here. It had a pleasant low level vibe without intruding on conversation. For those of us who hate loud restaurants, it was heaven. Vetri is pricey, so it's not an everyday, casual kind of place. But you get what you pay for.

Overall: Grassfed Missouri raised cow with homemade patties! Can you ask for more?

Ambience: This place is located in a busy corner of downtown STL. Parking is street only, just like most places in downtown. When you come inside, you'll notice, this restaurant is pretty big. You almost never need a reservation but it is good to have one for larger parties. The crowd is here everything from families to college friends to tourists.

Food: The place offers Missouri raised grass fed beef. So you know you're getting good stuff. If you're not into beef, their chicken burgers are also really good. I will say though their vegetarian patties aren't as flavorful. I have been to very few burger places that can do a good veggie patty. After all, this is a burger joint. We hope you didn't come here for veggie patty. We asked for ketchup and they had a house made version. I'll say, I'm not a fan of it. It tastes like puree than ketchup. The sauces on burgers could use some inspiration. They have the basics such as siracha, mayo, mustard, bbq... But if you really want to set your burger apart, step up your game on the sauce!

Drinks: They have a pretty nice bar with TVs, if you're looking for a place to eat by yourself. With that said their spiked shakes are pretty awesome. If you haven't, you should try their normal shakes and ice cream too!

Service: It was pretty busy when we came here, yet the service was fast. Our server cared for what we wanted and checked up on us a few times.

Price: $12-$14 for a burger with no sides is alright. You could throw fries with it and charge extra for other sides such as sweet potato fries or onion rings. Still can't complain.

The ambiance was lovely. So nice to be able to have a conversation in a restaurant. Having said this ---- Terrible service. We were sitting for 25 minutes before the waiter came to get drink orders. I had to ask the hostess to light a fire under him. Not that the young man wasn't nice. He just was poorly trained and slow. Looking around it seemed as if all the servers were away from the tables and out of the dining room most of the time. Back in the kitchen perhaps? Certainly not attending to our needs. At this price point I expect more and have gotten better service almost anywhere else in Philly. 
The food was just OK. My husband and I had the prime rib. I've had it elsewhere in Philly for a lot less and it's been comparable flavor wise. My friend had salmon which, again, was OK. The sides were OK. Nothing special. When it came time for coffee it was not presented with cream or sugar and when the sugar came, there was no teaspoon with which to stir it into the coffee. Don't know what the rave reviews are all about because we won't be back.

Everything we had was great, filet, truffle fries, bbq shrimp and redfish.  Len was our server and was so personable or and friendly.  Even if the food had only been ok, I would go back for his service.  Brought our kids balloons and was just so attentive to our table and others.  Highly recommend!!

Went for the puddin' so my review is narrowly-focused, this time around...

Prior reviewer mentioned Magnolia's in The Village (as in NYC). I have to agree, at least banana puddingwise, yes comparable. Magnolia's makes ice box cake, which we didn't see at Sweet Life, and I LOVE ice box cake... but I am also a Phulph'n, and Magnolia's ain't worth 2 hours on the Chinatown bus for pudding, when I can get some BETTER options here on South Street.

Unlike Magnolia's, Sweet Life has a variety of pudding flavors: peaches-n-cream, banana, banana caramel, salted caramel, no-nana, "magic" (like a Snickers bar), etc. And Sweet Life adds cake at the bottom, which I do not remember being in Magnolia's cups (just wafers). Bakery cake, all saturated with the pudding to make it thicker, was a really nice twist to America's idea of Jello snack cups.

Also got the potato pie, which was sweet, and spicey, and savory too. Very good!

Can't wait to try more next time!
Love this place! First time going and I will def be back. Got gel manicure and eyebrow wax. Staff was friendly, store was quiet & professional. Def a little hidden gem.
This place is amazing. Staff is friendly. Food is great. Don't miss out on the chorizo and cheese empanada! Chips and guacamole are also amazing. Make sure you check in to get a free empanada.
The Classic Roast Beef sandwich was excellent!! The baked Mac and cheese was ok and the Chai latte was low key! :/
Boyfriend and I were in Tampa for New Year's Eve weekend and had a great experience. Fun conversation and delicious food. Would deff come again.

Amazing food and good value for what you pay for. Very decent amount of food, I have leftovers for both of my two visits here. The dolsot bibimbap is really good. Perfect ambience for conversations, it's not too loud and the music is on point. Definitely will come back to try more dishes!

Always worth the wait. Filling this review out after I've gone a few times (5-6 times). Immaculate baked goods, inspiring latte combinations, creative soulful brunch food. I recommend grabbing a latte and a baked good to munch on while you wait. 

I've had few dishes I haven't loved.  I normally find it hard to narrow down the options, I normally ask the wait staff bc there always seems to be a few dishes that rise above the others. The sorghum bacon is always pretty impressive and a crowd pleaser and I've definitely ordered a few different versions of the Dutch baby. Happy brunching!

Cracker Barrel rarely disappoints. Wish there was one on Long Island. Went with a party of 4 and ordered the special cinnamon French toast special. It was as good as advertised. The wait for a table was a bit long but the food was fast and the waitress attentive.

The husband had a hankering for Asian food so we decided to check out this new Thai restaurant based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. We started of with their pork & shrimp dumplings. They looked more like Shu mai which was different than what we expected but very delicious. They have 4 spice levels; mild, medium, hot, & Thai hot. They are not kidding around with how spicy their food is. Normally I order the Pad Thai the first time I visit a Thai restaurant but decided to try the spicier Garlic Beef at their medium spice level. It was delicious & perfectly spicy. The hubby got the Panang curry chicken, medium spice, & it was delicious & perfectly spiced too. The portion sizes were just right. We finished off our meal with their sweet, sticky rice with mango. OMG, it was the best I've ever had! They use the black rice & it was warm & drizzled with hot sweetened, condensed milk. The mango was perfectly ripe & there was more than 2-3 slices. We will definitely go back. The hubby wants to try something hot.
Attention Vegans - they have a separate menu of dishes just for you!

This place is cute and I enjoyed myself. The salon was beautiful and well kept, and the owner or manager desk person was a total delight and I would go back for lashes or just a pedi bc the pedi there was honestly incredible the tech had me in heaven. Also the prices were reasonable.

But the mani is just meh. I didn't really inspect my nails when I left bc I was in a hurry. It's just frustrating I can do my own nails better and paint all the way to the sides without leaving a gap. But toying with an at-home LED lamp is a pain.

So the nitty gritty: There are little bumps and bubbles. I had to pick clear and colored gel off my skin later and trim where it had pooled in cuticles with nail scissors. Several nails were filed slightly assymetrically. Also they do something called wrapping their tips with a extra layer so it's sealed under and looks kind bulbous on the nail, like thicker visibly and to the touch at the tips. 

That being said the tech was super sweet and genuinely nice. But if I went again I would just stick to a pedi or request someone else for a mani.

Delicious chicken and po boys. I've been eating at Chubbies for over  33 years and still crave it all the time. Very tasty and good sized fried chicken. Good dirty rice. Best roast beef Poboy and oyster Poboy you will ever taste. Great fried seafood. One of the best hot sausage Poboys in the city. Reasonable prices. Designed mostly for take out. Small dining area and no bathroom. Overall very good food.
Always make a visit to a Delux when I'm in town.  The burgers are always amazing. The turkey celebrity burger is outstanding.
Food was really good and the staff was great! LOVED the live performer tonight! So talented!! Definitely coming back

These are some of the BEST cookies I have ever had. I bought a six pack of snickerdoodles and chocolate chips and ate them up faster than I should have. They are gooey and warm and definitely don't skimp on quality. I can't wait to go back and try an ice cream sandwich! I would recommend this place over Insomnia Cookies.
I come here regularly for manicures, pedicures, & some waxing. Love Phong & Tram! Good selection of gel colors. Great attention to detail :)

I freaking love this place. The food and drinks are alway top notch.  The jukebox has amazing tunes and the service is fun, friendly and I just want to take them home.  They rock.  Don't miss out. Go here and tip well they deserve it.

Went on a google/yelp search.  I had been to the Italian Market a few times and did not know that it existed.  All I can say is WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?????   Ordered a couple of pounds of Broccoli Rabe sausage and 4 aged strips.  My sons were raised on top end places for steak and asked me to go back for their birthday dinners.... well I am on my way today to pick up a few large steaks for the Q.  NOT CHEAP - but as with most things in life you get what you pay for.  I will be standing in the snow cooking tonight!!!!!

A colleague and I were in town on business and stayed at the attached hotel.  We stopped in here on two occasions during our stay.  The first experience was great.  We wanted a quick appetizer before meeting friends.  The BBQ nachos were delicious.  A decent-sized portion. Not too large and enough "stuff" to make your tastebuds happy. I also tried their in-house beer.  It was pretty good.  I was surprised.  Our bartender, Kevin, was very friendly.  Turns out he's also a damn fine musician too!  

Now, our second experience was quite the letdown.  We popped in for lunch.  I tried the fried bologna sandwich.  I was intrigued by something new.  I shouldn't have been.  It was a bit too fried for me and on plain old bread.  I opted for American cheese, which looked plastic-y and didn't cover the entire sandwich.  I felt slightly ill afterward, perhaps from the grease?  My colleague had the brisket sandwich.  She said the flavor was okay but that it was super fatty.  She also didn't feel great afterward.  

So, maybe stop in for an appetizer and music, but then head out?  I was disappointed that lunch wasn't as positive of an experience as lunch. Whomp whomp.

Groupers is definitely one of my favorite spots on the beach. My boyfriend and I come here at least twice a week. The seafood is FRESH and delicious. The staff is amazing and will always remember your name. The location is perfect and the restaurant is clean. A must try in Irb!

A happy and satisfying out-of-the-blue discovery today. That's an understatement...more like "Blown away!" Biggest, tastiest (and not greasy, at all) deluxe gyro I've had in St Louis, and I've been eating gyros for nearly 30 years...

p.s. The orzo salad was a gem too :)

Went about 1am after Lady Gaga concert on 12-1-2017 for something to eat. The woman that waited on us was pleasant however coffee was not hot just warm and as we are sitting eating our breakfast a small roach appear at the end of the table. I kill it with a napkin and proceed to finish my meal when another roach appear. Was not able to finish eating.  Upon paying the lady at the cash register provided a discount since I almost finish my food. Was not happy at all with this. Its a shame since I live nearby and have eaten here before, don't think I will again.

I eat here a lot and the food is very good.  Our server was gross last time with a dirty apron, licked her fingers and then touched the top lip of my water glass.  At least a couple of critical health violations.
Please train your servers on the health code.
I love this place. The food and coffee are excellent. On the weekends, expect a bit of a line but as a local, It's great and I would highly recommend their "Build your own" hashes.

Tuna Bar is a new sushi digs in Old City, a relatively upscale neighborhood in a city flooded with mediocre sushi restaurants. I frequent laban's favorites, bubblefish being one of them and the last visit left something to be desired. The fork in the road left me with two options, Royal Izakaya or Tuna Bar, and boy am I glad I chose the latter.

The ambiance is on point, and the service is friendly and welcoming. The menu is curated beautifully, from my understanding they narrowed it down quite a bit from the other location. This means everything on the menu is guaranteed to be fantastic and FRESH.

We started with the steamed chicken dumplings which were light and steamed to perfection. The ginger salad followed with slices of avocado and wonderfully balanced ginger dressing that wasn't too sweet. And they even do spring mix, which was great considering romaine isn't the best these days. 

For our sushi selections we went with the classic dragon roll, the east roll, the j & j roll, and 4 pieces of the tasmanian salmon, which is a fattier cut of wild caught alaskan salmon. The fish absolutely melted in your mouth and highlighted the night beautifully. The dragon roll was crafted wonderfully and the rice on every selection seemed to highlight the delicate subtleties of genuinely fresh fish. The wasabi was even a notch above. I don't know what else I can say besides try it for yourself. The preparation of everything was so wonderfully thought out and you can tell they care about what they do here. Ken was also present and very humble about my compliments.

6/5

Nothing fancy but it does have some delicious Vietnamese food.  My son loves it here especially the shrimp rockets and shrimp & pork noodle soup.  The beef pho is yummy.  Perfect on a cold day too!  Great service - quick and attentive but they aren't obnoxious about it.  Love coming here.

Easiest 5 stars I've given in a while. I got the grilled ham n cheese with egg on top. Omg I savored every bite. My wife got the raclette Patty melt and it was luscious and perfect. Beers were on point too. Just eat here.
Place looks like a speak easy from outside. I went on trivia night, it was fun, didn't try the food.

After a beautiful autumn walk through the Botanical Gardens I stopped in for lunch. It is basically a old service station turned restaurant, but don't let that throw you off. Trust me - you will love this place. 

Think vintage oil cans and crystal decanters with silver trays and copper tagines. Add to the mix a variety of artisanal gin, rye and Japanese whiskey served over an upbeat but chill background music (Like ARE & BE on Spotify).

I ordered the Ugni blanc with some baba ganoush and the autumn root vegetable tagine. Homemade bread was amazing and everything was delicious. I'll let the photo do the talking.

I'll be back!
Love this place. Come in sit in the back,  relax and have some me time.  They have all types of spiritual  items for sale. Really nice gifts too.

All I have to say is NANCY! She is the best waitress I've ever had. My friend and I love Cracker Barrel and it is always such a treat to go in and see Nancy's welcoming smile! She is attentive, funny and excellent at making great food suggestions. Go there and great service and great food!!

Love this place. Good food and pleasant servers. 
Pancakes are wonderful as well as the California BLT.

This place is delicious! Consistently. Their smoothies are amazing, sandwhichs and wraps are well balanced and delicious, their salads are flavorful, though a bit wet towards the end. Friendly service. Be mindful of lunch time as it can take quite some time to get your food but if you order ahead, you'll be fine! LOVE this place.
The Churros are mouth watering Delisious service was amazing there tacos are fabulous overall they are amazing

Having my hair done at the same place in NJ for 8 years, I was super nervous to switch hair colorists when I moved to the area. Kadi, however, exceeded all my expectations and did an amazing job on my color. I am so happy I bit the bullet and tried someplace new!

I love the menu,but im a local an i been here many times and there is never a good satisfying  good welcome or would u like to oreder!! Nothing not even a hi! Just a straight face!! Love love the items on the menu!!! But costumers service sucks !!!    
 Worst part!!! When i ask for a container to go! The cashier did not even bother to strive to make up for the straight face! Without a word she just pointed at the to go containers!!!!
Two visits on my trip. Excellent food and service! Had the oyster Benedict and the seafood Benedict.  Awesome grits as well!

We ate here on a Friday night and had a great time!

Our service was the best we've had anywhere in a long time. Christina was super nice and helpful as well as attentive to us. Great food and drinks as well. 

Located in a good spot on the strip next to a few hotels, you can't beat something this good within walking distance. They have a lot of seating which is always nice (and a good sign).

I had the shrimp tacos which were amazing. They were sweeter than I normally like, as I normally like spicy, but they were delicious. They had jicama coleslaw with pineapple in it. The sauce on top really perfected it.

My husband had the blackened grouper sandwich which was cooked perfectly. 

Definitely recommend!

I LOVE the food and drinks here, I've never had anything I didn't like. My favorite is the grilled cheese, mixing apples and cheese is my favorite, so this sandwich is a hit for me. The decor is awesome as well, very unique and and fun. What I find really disappointing is the service. The past few times I've been in I've had the same male server who has been less than stellar. We wait maybe 10 minutes to give an order, waited 30 minutes for our first drinks, and then another 20 for the check. I would have loved to order a couple more drinks and maybe some desert, but waiting on the server 30 minutes per drink is something I don't have time for. The other staff seemed to be working really hard and even helped us out a little when our server was no where to be found, I wish I would have had one of them instead.

The staff was extremely nice, the service superb and fast!  Was visiting and got a bit sick of all the fried foods.  I'm Vietnamese so pho is always a staple and nice to have as an option when you're dehydrated from non stop adult beverages!  Went here with the husband and friend.  The pho was good and I also enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee. The atmosphere is super cute.
Awesome. Had the eggs Benedict. Hollandaise sauce was perfect. Don't miss this place.

We were a bit scared to order food here. The place had some stale smell. But, we decided to be brace & order food anyway since we were starving & felt lazy to find another place. Ceviche is awesome. Would go there again. Burrito & quesadilla were good too. Very reasonable too. Good food & portion!

Visiting New Orleans for the first time... my sister had a taste for oysters and we found this place here, so we decided to try it.... turned out to be amazing. I order oysters, crab mac and cheese, and southern greens, everything was delicious!!!!

Stopped in for breakfast on a rainy Sunday afternoon.  We didn't have to wait but a minute for our table for two. It was the smallest table for two I've ever sat. Despite that, we had an amazing meal. You don't come here for atmosphere or experience....just amazing food. I had the shrimp and grits. I'm not a southern so grits is not often in the top of my list but it's one of the things out waitress recommended and I am so glad that she did. It was out of this world. Warm, creamy, cheesy and savory with ample and flavorful shrimp.  My partner had a more traditional breakfast with eggs bacon toast hash browns and pancakes. It was good. But he admitted he chose poorly once has tasted mine. The pancakes were excellent btw. Cake like.

Let's get this out of the way right now: it's pronounced "Ah-vuh" NOT "Ay-vuh" a fact that distinguishes the restaurant from the young lady it is named after.  I have been to Ava plenty of times but never wrote a review prior to now...it's time to spread the love! 

My first experience at Ava was during Creative Loafing's Restaurant Week Tampa Bay in 2015. Since then I've been to Ava several times, mostly for dinner with family and friends and sometimes for lunch. I've also visited Ava to pick up food as an UberEats delivery person.  

Having visited Ava several times, I am certain about a few loves: 

1. The ambiance. It's perfect -- lively yet romantic; trendy yet comfortable. Ava offers al fresco dining (covered outdoor seating) as well as a variety of table styles inside (from classy high tops to traditional table seating). Be sure to ask about the "Secret Dining Room" if you're in need of a reservation for at least 10 guests! 

2. The Casarecce al Pomodoro. I love to order this dish with extra ricotta and sometimes, if I'm feeling frisky, with the Nduja sausage (this is a spicy sausage which is different from the fennel sausage). 

3. The Ava House Salad. It's a bit on the pricy side at $8.00, but the ingredients (mixed greens, cucumber, radish, tomato, red onion tossed in a house Italian vinaigrette) offer the perfect explosion of flavors pre-entree.

4. Joe Maddon. He is part owner of Ava and he is former manager of the Tampa Bay Rays...so duh, he is a love.

Also, for solo diners, Ava is one restaurant that has an incredibly welcoming bar that erases all of the unnecessary shame in dining alone. Trust me, I've done it time and time again.  :)
why did you burn the building down that was my favorite pizza place. I know you guys wanted to vacation but you don't have to burn it down. whatever now I have to eat pasta Mista

Overall great experience, vibe, location and atmosphere. 
Great service and food
Bread should be included - not extra
Poke was very good - but should be tuna. 
Cheese plate was great
Fried chicken - very good- but not the best I've ever had, moist and delicious though, jalapeno grits tasty, collard greens very good
Strogranoff was good- meet a little dry, could have been a little more flavorful
Overall deserts were a let down- mousse was ok, cookie tray average- only saving grace was the caramel/toffee, carrot cake sunday- meh. 
Lastly - everytime they brought a course they gave the plates and drinks to the wrong person- I'm sure this will improve with time
Wine list decent - but way over priced.
We will return- and I'm sure some of these things will improve.
I have been here a couple times now with some great friends and the service is always amazing and the food is even better. Its is totally worth the wait to get seated!

Didn't feel like cooking so i ordered the crabs from uber eats. I guess they were having a bad day yesterday because when I ate their crabs I got food poisoning. Threw up all night. My suggestion is if you want a near death experience get the crabs.
My favorite grocery store, I think they are wonderful but they need more gluten free items like Safeway.

If you know me, you know I do not try different burger joints at all!! Nothing compares to my local Beach Corner joint. Well I tried this Smashburger place and it was tasty. I've only been twice, and both times was great.

One my last visit, I had a double cheeseburger with bacon on it. The meat cooked perfect. One my first visit, i had fries to go with it but it was not regular fries ( I prefer the regular fries over the fancy fries that were ordered). 

The location is great. Magazine street right where all of the great bars are located. The service is good and the location is impressively clean. 

The only complaint I have with the burgers are, they are very very greasy.

What a wonderful surprise to find this gem in downtown Reno.   Food was delicious.  Try the Fried Chicken salad.  Soooo good.  Also had the burger that tasted like it was grilled outside.  Their fries were thin and delicious.  The service was five star.
They offered a variety of wonderful dinner fair.  Check out the menu online.  I will definitely go there again.
Lyndel our waitress was helpful and accommodating for our family and 2 year old daughter. Appreciated the care and many thanks!

I read about this Restaurant in the Sauce magazine and thought it would be a good spot to dine. I was disappointed in the seating,food, and price. 

For the price I would think you would have a waiter or waitress. Food was average. Portions where ridiculously small. 2 deviled eggs for $6.....GEESH.

I'm not sure if the cook knows what the original recipes looked like before he prepared it but h has to do some research. 


I had the catfish, sweet potatoes, and pork cracklings cornbread. Catfish was average and small portions. Sweet potatoes where bland, and the cornbread had NO pork cracklings in it, google it when you get a chance. 

Overall I didn't enjoy it.

Literally spent 2hrs+ making sure each curl is strategically placed  constantly asking how I like it so far and if I need any water, coffee, wine etc  and I was seriously shocked when I saw the price as it was way lower then I had expected, considering the princess treatment I had received. Thank you again. Hubby also approved

Well, good food, reasonable price. But as they themselves advertised, the service is indeed slow. I waited 20 mins to get my water, and another 10 mins to place the order, and yet another 20 mins to get the food. I went there twice. Both time, I experience good food + slow services. 

Will I come again? Well, maybe. I will make sure I sit inside or near the door at porch so that servers could see me.

Good place for hangover ,not a usual place to eat . Great food (Mexican) people are very nice . Is not a fancy restaurant with all kind electronics things . It's a mom and pops place . Food is real you can get as Mexican culture . Try!!! But be OPEN MIND

The best of the best! Great outfitters with great employees. This business cares about its customers,even to the point of closing if conditions are unsafe on the river. That costs them revenue but they put safety first!

Thanks so much for the help in finding a last minute rental! Love that it wasn't just the dress but I got the pearls and headband to go with it and for a reasonable price. Beats having to buy everything separately.  The ladies were so friendly and helpful too. Can't wait to come back for the next theme party :)

Hubbard's Marina Offers 5 hr trips that go out about an hour offshore, fish for 3 hours, and then travel an hour back to trhe dock.  I do not recommend  these 5 hour trips to experienced ocean anglers. Simply put, this 5 hour trip does not go out far enough or deep enough to get to large grouper, large snapper, amerjack, tuna and other larger fish that most of us experienced fisherman are looking for. It is strictly 3 hrs of bottom fishing for grey snapper, hogfish, sand perch, and many other fish that are not very big at the approximately 50 ft depth they fish at on these trips.  I went on 10 trips from December of 2017 through July of 2017, then quit going because I never saw a fish bigger than 6 lbs caught on any of the 10 trips. This 5 hr trip, in my opinion, is a good experience for tourists, and children, but not for serious fishermen.  The pictures of all the huge fish they display on their website and emails, I conjecture, were probably taken from rare instances over long periods of time, and from the more expensive longer trips to deep waters.
GREAT BRUNCH!!  Service on point. We are always in search of a great place for Sun brunch. Did a search and this place came up. Looking forward to having a D-n-D there soon.

The best chocolate croissant (petit pain au chocolat) I had in USA!  I like the atmosphere, very industrial look. The place is shared with a wine bar, so you can have an excellent sandwich made with a French baguette and a glass of wine. It was too early for me. I would recommend this place.

You know, all I did was stand in line to buy a suit for my little boy.  I realize the clothing is used and certainly don't expect it to be treated as a new buy.  All I needed was a hanger to hang the suit on so it wouldn't get wrinkled in the bag.  The older lady with glasses checking me out told me I could buy a hanger for the suit.  If I wasn't desperate, with a sick kid at home, whom I'm trying to nurse back to health for a piano recital tomorrow, I probably would have let this pass.  Saver's I hope a hanger was worth losing my future business.  I suggest you provide some kindness training for the rude and non-compassionate human you have working for you....Transaction 8797, register 7, operator 1515, 10:34a.  I'll go elsewhere next time where I can be treated with little kindness and respect.

The Hispanic man with the glasses is the nastiest person I have encountered by far in a long time. I went to go grab some napkins and he made me ASK FOR HIS PERMISSION. I hope someone heals your rude soul. Will never be going near this place ever again

We were in town for NYE and always try to find a local spot to eat,  this one is a definite return visit spot!  BBQ nachos were good,  she got pulled pork and I got Brisket platter.  It was all great!  The Brisket is the best I have ever eaten!  You can't go wrong!

Very good experience. There were five of us. Everyone enjoyed the appetizers, main entree and drinks. Service was excellent and personable. The prices good.  Ambiance is pleasant and relaxing. Cost is reasonable. Looking forward to our next visit!
Excellent and fresh sushi! Started with the soba noodles and ginger salad. So delicious! I got the J&J roll and I wish I had ordered two!! Best sushi I've had in the city by far.
I love this place. This is my #1 spot for sushi. Food  is fresh and the services is excelente.

Mixed feelings. It has a very rich history, and is definitely a great place to visit if you're in town. It's an upscale place, but they have this indoor patio area that is not as fancy but the same menu. The indoor patio area might as well be outdoors because I was FREEZING. I could barely drink my water cause it was so cold. 

Our waitress was also terrible. She was very inattentive, slow, and forgetful. We waited a ridiculous amount of time waiting to order, for our check, etc. 

My friend got the Cajun chicken, and I got the pork chop. The food was GREAT. the bread they bring in the beginning was also out of this world, very unique. My friends wine glass was dirty, and they quickly got her a new glass. 

Did definitely appreciate the sanitary door opener in the bathroom!

Celiacs in the area def need to check out this place!
They have a number of gluten free options and accommodate to preventing cross contamination to the best of their abilities if you mention your dietary needs.
My fav thing from there is their chicken quesadillas.

Pretty good breakfast/brunch place.  Honeybee Crepe was a great, balanced, sweet-savory treat -- if maybe a little too carb-y (crepe was pretty thick).  I also would have liked a side salad with that.  I stole my partner's and it was fresh and good.  I ordered a cortado and received something more similar to a latte -- espresso-milk ratio was too milk-heavy.  The space is nice, but was very smoky both upstairs and downstairs.  Don't come here if you have asthma?

Overall, a friendly, cozy place with good food.  Crepes (and omelettes) are pretty massive, so if i come back i'll likely get something to split.

I've been here 3 times before and loved it. But tonight... the kitchen is SO slow. My family and I waited on our food (two sir chicken sandwiches and a cheese omelet) for twenty five minutes. Our server was really nice and apologetic. But it really shouldn't have taken 25 minutes to make two sandwiches and an omelet.

We came across this place as my family and I were visiting New Orleans and we were taking a walk from the hotel to the French Quarter around 11am on a Saturday. We were seated immediately and the staff were all absolutely friendly. I was not familiar with Louisiana food so I appreciated the thorough explanation given when I asked what's bayou etc. Since we were there for brunch, we had two omelettes which were both good, friend alligator, shrimp po-boy, and a bayou bowl. Everything was great except I'm a little disappointed with the alligator meat - because it was fried it tasted like chicken to me, I can't really tell I was eating alligator. I wish there were options to choose from in terms of how you want the meat cooked.

The Looking Glass is great local boutique. The majority of the store focuses on engraving and etching vases, cutting boards, wine glasses and various household items. The great thing is the engraving is more than just a monogram. The other part of the store hosts local crafts, jewelry and children's clothing.

I was starved and this tiny place served up some deliciousness. I had an omelette, hash browns and toast. My hubby said his banana pancakes were the best he ever had. The oysters Benedict was loved by another member of my party. Everything on the table was eaten. Sorry no pics, we are it up too fast. The long wait was well worth it. I'll be back next time I'm in New Orleans. I rank this a full point above Ruby Slipper on taste.

Huge portions, great service. Had the fried chicken with the crawfish sauce. The chicken wasn't seasoned at all but paired with the sauce it was very good. I only ate half have a whole meal left over.

3 words... donut bread pudding. OMG. Insane. Not too sweet, light fluffy goodness with coconut & fresh cream. It's a dream. Trust me, save room for it. Service was also divine. Servers who weren't even ours stopped to ask if we had what we needed, if we were liking things etc. Really an awesome experience. We will be back for a dinner! 

Update: we came back for dinner and the burger will change your life!!
We are from out of town here on vacation. We really enjoyed the restaurant and the fish tank display. There is a lot of interesting Guy Harvey merchandise up front also.

Where was I before Orange Theory? Oh that's right, on my couch drinking wine every night complaining about not being in shape. I had a friend that praised this place and after awhile when one popped up in mid city, I decided to give it a try. Initially I said no because of the price, but once you calculate the cost it's really not so bad. Health is wealth baby. Immediately from my first class, I knew I had made a good decision. Not only was the staff extremely welcoming and personable, but I loved everything about the concept. It literally pushes you to work harder and get in shape. I don't have the drive to do it on my own, so fortunately this was exactly what I needed. I've been coming for 3 months now and no workout has ever been the same. I love the energy when u walk inside. For people like me who have extremely hectic and inconsistent work schedules, this is perfect. All you do is download the app and you schedule according to what works best for you. They have classes all day at all different times. If your wondering about bringing headphones or making a playlist, don't bother. The instructors have the music bumping when u walk in. I haven't taken everyone's class, but Brandon, Jeff, and Josh's music selection definitely will have you in the zone. Everyone needs a little trap music in their life lol. If I haven't convinced you by now, then go in and see for yourself. They willingly will give u a walk through and let u do a trial class. Thank me later!
Delivery driver didn't bring entire delivery, said he would go back to store to grab it and didn't return. Store refused to refund money!

Solid spot for brunch. 

Mr. F always goes to Jones when in the City of Brotherly love.  This place is always hopping so be sure to make reservations in advance.  

Mr. F always goes for the monkey bread with that sweet semeny glaze.  It's so delicious. Mr. F also enjoys the make your own Bloody Mary. They have plenty of options for everyone's palate (cucumber ice cubes are awesome). 

Other favorites include the cheesesteak omelette, chicken & waffles, and the mac & cheese. Mr. F did not see the delicious potato pancakes on the menu last time he was there.   He hopes they bring them back. 

One word of warning to my fellow bears. The booths here are a little tight. If you are truly big, sexy, and burly you may want to choose a table.

Cool ambiance, great food! Definitely order the Yakitori, we had chicken thigh, very tender and moist. The duck fried rice was yummy too.  The Japanese beer, Orion, was really good too, never had it before but good drinking beer.

The place looked interesting enough, the live music was pleasant enough, the food and drink were over priced and marginal at best, but the coupe de grace was delivered when I received the check. I had asked for an additional portion of herbed mayonaise that accompanied my Cuban sandwich, upon examination of the check, I found a $1 charge for a table spoon of mayo. Unbeliebvable. I said something to the manager who did nothing but say "that's how it is."
Don't be lured by the interesting exterior......this place is not worth your time or money and the management is completely tone deaf on customer perception of value; $8 for a 10oz glass of common IPA, $18 for lack luster fish tacos plus mayo for $1. There are much better options in that town or accross the river.

Amazing food and service. Excellent EXO coffee. 
Vegetarian and gluten free options. Highly recommended!!
I used the app to put our party on the wait list and by the time we arrived we were seated In under 10 minutes. 
What a gem of a place!!

We are regulars. Its one of our places for sushi rolls. Very clean place. I think they need to change up the menu a little more often. I personally dont care for much of the hot foods. Just dont like the sauce. Soups are GREAT. I would tell you to go.

I was really good pizza and wings. I would definitely come back. We came with kids and it was ok. I guess it depends on what you have in mind for the atmosphere. There's a lot of tvs so with kids it can be distracting but that's what people are there for to watch a game and eat pizza. Overall good and definitely good food.

Really 2.5 stars.  Arrived shortly before 1 on a Saturday to an empty hostess station and not a server in sight.  There were three tables with customers so not busy.  We waited a few minutes and the bartender saw us and seated us in the bar.  She was fairly friendly.  As stated in other reviews the chips are not complementary.  I had a craving for nachos as my meal anyway so I didn't care.  The bartender recommended the buffalo chicken nachos so that is what I ordered.  You do not want the nachos.  The tortilla chips are too thick, under salted and boring.  The toppings were quite good.  Hubby ordered the restaurant's equivalent of a pulled pork sandwich and fries.  Sad fries... too greasy so they lack crispness.  The sandwich he found to be just ok.  The pork in my opinion had great flavor.  We were underwhelmed and in a town with lots of Mexican food we will not be back.

Sahm's has the market cornered when it comes to family friendly restaurants! I'm well aware of the several Sahm's locations, the Big Lug brewery, and recent acquisition of Bent Rail in South Broad Ripple, but this was my first time at Roost, despite working in the area for over 10 years. 

During an early errand run with my daughter, I checked the area for a breakfast spot. I was reminded of this spot I've passed dozens of times, on the SE corner of Allisonville and 116th. We were seated quickly and greeted by a festive woman donned in sparkles and a Santa hat. 

As with other locations, they had specials, in addition to a full breakfast & lunch menu. I ordered a scramble and bacon that came with hash browns and an order of biscuits and gravy and toast. Z got an omelet with a side of fruit and a waffle. 

The portions were large and the hash browns were just the way I liked them. The gravy was a bit on the runny side, but not terrible. 

There's a breakfast 'bar' that several people were seated around and the restaurant filled up quickly while we were there. 

While they don't serve cocktails, its a perfect spot for a family meal. You can even order their famous bundt cake to go!
Great food, love all their options! Just don't expect a quick in-and-out during lunchtime rush. This location is particularly busy around noon.

Food is always great here. I've had one really bad experience here with the Daniel guy here, he's a very unfriendly guy and should not be working here. But the server Sofia is definitely the most friendliest server there. She's always smiling and talking to you making you feel comfortable, so always ask for Sofia.

We'd heard about this opening recently at the KOP mall, and my wife had tried it a few days ago, so we decided to stop in after a walk at Valley Forge. It's pretty close to the mall entrance near Cheesecake Factory, and it's a nice little space. No real place to sit and drink the bubble tea, but cute shop with a section with lots of Asian snacks. There's not as much variety of choice of tea here compared to other bubble tea places, but it's largely because they focus on using fresh fruit in their teas, and don't use powders.

The tea is definitely tasty, though a bit on the pricey side. My wife got a cold mango tea with sago, and I got a hot ginger milk tea. The mango tea was very refreshing and light, and the ginger milk tea was really great for a chilly day. It wasn't super hot, so I could drink it through a straw. I probably wouldn't have minded it being hotter, but it was delicious. I would totally get that again, or try another ginger tea...

Very good.... my daughter loved the food and thought the staff was very nice.  The owner or manager was at the table several times and delivered our food.  The seafood ravioli was excellent and so was the fresh tomato and basil sauce.  It was authentic and well done.  (Italians in the restaurant business- so not easily impressed)

My first time here.  Service was good, and the sushi was good quality.  But I'm giving it three stars because of the Wasabi.  It was terrible.  Not spicy.  No flavor.  Like puréed potatoes with green food coloring in it.  Sorry but if your specialty is Sushi, you need to have at least decent/passable wasabi.  Everything else was good.
I recommend getting the migas. We had to wait about 20 min to get a table but we had 5 people in our group. If you're looking for a lively place for brunch, check this place out :)
Incredible incredible food. Atmosphere is quiet and comfortable. Definitely recommend.
I'm a coffee lover and this place has the BEST LATTE ever!!!! We had hot latte and my boyfriend had iced vanilla latte. He likes his vanilla latte and I LOVED my hot latte!

I've been coming to this restaurant for 25 years. The nostalgic layout is appealing. Waitresses are friendly and familiar. Unfortunately due to its size gets too busy on Saturday and Sunday mornings. You have to pick a good time or prepare to stand. Raised prices a few years ago. Taking it from a really good bargain to a moderate one. 

My first bad experience was today otherwise I would rate it higher. 8:30 AM on a Monday in December and the restaurant was almost empty because I was by myself I was not allowed to sit at one of the eight open tables. I was not interested in sitting at the counter and there were plenty of seats and no one at the door. That's just bad business. I left embarrassed because I happen to be alone this time.

Amazing! Great food! Great ambiance! Great service! I got the bacon cheeseburger on a gluten free bun. The best burger I have ever had. I love finding great places that offer gluten free options. I'm definitely going to come back here! Prices are not to high. My burger was $10.39. The price is great for how big the burger was!
These guys are artists! Their beer selection and relaxed environment is always great. Love this place!
First time here, but the beer is outstanding and the Baja fish tacos were excellent! Really nice atmosphere for a brewpub, my server, Andres, was very attentive and got a nice tip for his service.

We stopped by for a quick lunch and ordered a classic and the Depot burger, we asked specifically that they be rare, the classic came in closer to medium, and Depot burger had no pink at all, why is it so hard to make a rare burger. Any way the food was good, the grilled onions we're awesome. Our waitress was great and the over cook burger was removed from our bill with an apology. Talk about being a stand up place, we will go again and most likely recommend.

I love love love the Teriyaki Burrito tonight it was all burrito and no teriyaki. This is something special so when it is ordered someone ought to take great care to make it what ii is supposed to be. Maybe next time.

Very good food served fast and friendly,   Meal was hot and beer cold like it should be.  It's in the station so weather effects room temperature it's 18 outside so it's cool in side the station.   Would rather not watch CNN (Fake News) or NFL but little story telling is good to laugh at.  I would eat here again if passing through on train. Had the philly streak, fries very very good very good. Cost with a Philadelphia pale ale (bottle) $20.82
High quality comfort food. We braved the cold for over an hour, standing in the queue. Was it worth it? Sure, by a nose.

Ordered from here before they moved to the new location, so maybe the food has also changed. Ordered delivery for a few co-workers. The wait was long. In fact, a prior attempt to order from here was cancelled because the delivery time was 2 hours...we didn't even get things that were cooked, so this was confusing.

I got a salad. It was fresh enough for a deli that probably specializes in sandwiches, but the dressing was awful.  It was thick and gritty with sugar. I actually had to add a few spoonfuls of water to thin it out and dissolve the sugar. I would have actually preferred bottled dressing at that point. 

Overall, no one was impressed. Prices are decent, but the food was just average.

Nice little restaurant/ bar near Vanderbilt. Free parking for 1.5 hours (which is super awesome because there's barely any free parking in this town anymore!) service and food are good. Menu and drinks are also reasonably. The verde dip is one of my favs, as well as the gang feathers on a Caesar salad!

Went for the Saturday lunch buffet. Beautifully set up, lots of dishes I had never tried before. Service was ok- water guys were obsessive as in most Indian places around here and very accommodating to our two small children. Food was excellent! Well worth the few extra minutes drive!

11 different protein options. Each are 3oz. Unlike other places that squash their patties flat and removes most of the juices, these are thicker and juicer with more flavor, they are just smaller in diameter. These are truly mini burgers with many fresh toppings. Sliders are typically 1oz or less. The sweet potato fries are awsome.

This was a great meal! So worth the money!! Had the Hey Lucy omelette and it was just so good! Plenty to fill you up for a long day on the beach. My daughter wanted a salad that came with salmon on it and she's a vegetarian so she asked it without and they did it and then adjusted the price which was really awesome!! Fun drinks and great services! I would recommend this place to all.

Went last night before his company Christmas jamboree and the food and service were wonderful!

This place was moderately busy on a Friday night, we were way overdressed because we had to do his party afterwards. The hostess was quick to greet us and super friendly.

We were led to a booth and our server was Katie, who was on the ball and incredibly charming. I ordered the scallops, subbed out mashed potatoes for the rice and my food was perfect. The scallops were perfectly cooked and succulent. The mash was tasty and even the vegetables were fantastic. The two drinks I had were really tasty and strong too, the bartender is on it! 

My date had the steak which comes with a killer marinade and was perfectly cooked and juicy. I was delighted with my scallops but the steak was so good! I wish they would do a surf and turf! 

Finished with cheesecake that was dense and creamy and it ended the night perfectly. 

Bathrooms were cute and clean with kitschy beach signs in the stalls. The crowd was upbeat and the staff were all smiles and laughter. 

Wonderful. We can't wait to go again!

Easily the closest hotel to Independence Hall. 20 yards to the IH security checkpoint. 100 yards from the Liberty Bell. Easy to walk almost everywhere. Scores of great restaurants and bars close by.
Perfect service. Had a king room over looking the "park" - which really means your room looks right at Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell. Definitely pick that option! Xmas week prices under $200/night?? Easily worth double!
Best sushi. Highly recommend. The sushi rolls were very good especially the crunch roll and the service was fast..one of the waiter looks like Jared Leto too!
Good pizza and great delivery.  Right on time.  I liked the eggplant parm pizza a lot.  The pepperoni was OK.  I'll definitely order from there again.
When I order nachos from a restaurant I expect the cheese to be grated cheese, not  the liquid dispense from a nozzle movie theater variety. Gross

Great color selection. Good prices. Friendly staff. If you don't want to destroy your nails with gel, they have weekly polish for a few $ more than a regular manicure that lasts about 10 days. Very clean, and you get a drink with your service. All good things!

Ox tail pho made for a great meal and the crepe appetizer was a hit with the table. My gf got the crab and garlic noodles, but they were out of crab so they upgraded to the lobster at no extra cost. Turned out the lobster was fantastic! Only down sides were the duck was dry and touch and the taps were not yet installed, the taps will be up and running soon. Hopefully the duck prep will improve or change to something else...

This is a great urgent care clinic with caring staff and built to last. I need to keep writing this review it's the thing I have to do. Why go anywhere else? Expect the best and leave a thing on Yelp.

What a great find! Great family owned, local spot! Took a chance during a busy Saturday and so glad we did. The food was fantastic. Husband and I split the cinnamon bun french toast with the homemade sausage and the spinach omelet. Yum! Owner and staff were super kind and personable. Great family vibes!

We dropped by 21st Amendment for some late-night cocktails in French Quarter without going to the rowdier spots. Given that this was close to where we were staying (the Marriott), it was easy to pop out and roll over to 21st Amendment, which was only a few minutes away. There wasn't a line outside, but it was packed by the time we made it inside (sometime between 10-11 PM)...standing-room only, with the seats at the high-top tables and the bar taken. The decor and ambiance is a bit more retro, but like all New Orleans spots in this fashion, it feels homey, and it was enhanced by the fact that the band in the bar playing live music was absolutely entrancing the audience, with some folks even doing some dancing right at the front.

That said, I did come here initially because it was rated highly for drinks, and on that front, the cocktails do not disappoint. The bartenders make the drinks expertly, whether you stay on-menu or stray off by giving some general preferences. The beer selection is more generic, with specific bottles being the big-label brands, and no names given for listings like 'seasonal' or 'IPA'. Nonetheless, the drinks are made quickly but consistently - something I appreciated given how busy it was that night. Pricing was reasonable, relatively speaking - $13 a cocktail is a bit expensive, but the quality was very good, making it a bargain compared to some places in New York that I have been to.

21st Amendment really has a nice cozy feel to it, and with great drinks and great music, it's hard to go wrong. It doesn't have the kind of 'fun' you'd find half a block over on Bourbon Street, but at my age, it's the kind of fun that I'd rather have. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

We recently moved to the Tampa area from Austin and have been searching for a good place for wings and football. We found our new home!!

North 30 is not very convenient to where we live (Northdale), but worth the trip. The hot naked wings are excellent! Not obnoxiously spicy, but perfect amount of heat.

The number of tv's and variety is just what we are looking for. And the staff is very friendly.
I had the short rib and had a taste of the sautéed scallops from my wife's dish along with sharing the cheese platter. It was delicious

First time here.  The atmosphere is nice.  Busy spot. 
Pros: Wonderful menu,  amazing - delicious food, generous portions,  friendly - good wait staff, outdoor seating. 
Cons: You have to pay to park - no validat ing, limited outdoor seating. 

Summary: Overall a good place to eat. Nice for brunch as well.  Needs better parking or offer validating.

The food was good (definitely on the pricier side), but the service was terrible. Probably the most hipster restaurant I've been to in Reno, but I would not recommend this place if you're trying to have an intimate date night. The music in the restaurant is super loud. 

Service: After my boyfriend and I were seated, it took the waiter at least 15 minutes to get us water. The food took a long time to come out and our main dishes came out at different times. After finishing dinner, we asked for the check and I think the waiters completely forgot about us because we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. I would expect restaurants to want to turn tables over quickly, but for some reason service was super slow. For the poor customer service and overall dining experience, three stars.

Food: Tried the crab croquet. Pretty tasty, but I don't think it warrants the high price tag. Three crab croquets for $13 is a little steep.

Also had the spicy miso ramen ($16) and the wicked fried rice with duck cracklings ($14). I'd say the ramen here is probably better than other places I've been to in Reno, but nearly double the price. The broth wasn't super rich, but presentation and little vegetables were nice. The wicked fried rice was pretty good. The cracklings definitely add texture and the duck on top was cooked well.

Salty's is great!  The service is awesome, really friendly and enthusiastic and completely welcoming to the swarms of tourists like us.
The shrimp appetizer was a bummer, just warm shrimp with old bay floating in a bowl of water.  The water was yucky and distilled the flavor, so these really should be served dry.
The fish and shrimp tacos were both really great and nice and full of seafood. Drink specials were good, and the sour/midori margarita was delicious.

Originally was headed to get food elsewhere but they were fortuitously closed so our group headed here for lunch.  What a great place!  Unpretentious. Super friendly. Absolutely delicious Po boys and drinks. Those bloody Mary's and beer in a large chalice were key.  Katey, our server, was precious. She made this place even more enjoyable! Would highly recommend!
Woodhouse provides a luxurious spa experience. If you're looking to be pampered this is the place!

I was really excited to try this place since it's the first place I've heard of that has boba, Thai rolled ice cream, and crepes. It's about a 15 minute drive from USF campus and the GPS doesn't take you to the exact location which is within a large shopping plaza next to Aldi's market. 

There weren't that many flavors of boba besides the staple flavors. I opted to try was the galaxy tea which came in four flavors: Passionfruit, mango, strawberry, and lychee. It comes in a plastic light bulb cup and has basil seeds already included. The drink tasted similar to lemonade and was very sweet (most likely because I chose passion fruit). It was interesting to taste but I wouldn't order it again. The crepe menu has about 8 options you can choose from sweet or savory concoctions. I ordered the fruit crepe that had blueberries, strawberries, bananas, and kiwi. I was really disappointed that my crepe was cold when I got it and the filling was mediocre. The fruits were fresh but the crepe itself was chewy and bland so It wasn't enjoyable to eat. 

Overall, I feel like this place has potential if they were to improve the quality of the crepe and had a larger drink selection.

I absolutely love this location. The cashier I spoke to was very friendly and energetic to everyone around and made the experience of shopping here that much better. I bought some eyeshadow here and although a little expensive it's very nice.

Hard not to enjoy yourself with all the excitement popping around you at a casino like The Hard Rock!

What fun.  1st off I must confess I've never been a huge fan of slot machines.  Never understood some of the crazier games, and I usually just end up losing money there.

Table games, however, that's where it's at!  I enjoy Let it Ride - a 5-card stud poker game you play with the house where 10s or better pays out.  Sounds easier than it is - but if you play at a $10 min or less table you can last awhile through a losing streak and bounce back.

They also have a poker room with $1/$2 blind no-limit tables.  I'm personally used to tournament play but this is great if you want to drop in and play without the tournament commitment.

Plenty of food options, no charge for parking (smart - when they changed this briefly I was stunned), and live entertainment.  Wish there wasn't smoking, but hey, it's a casino!

We went on a Monday around 9 am and avoided all lines. There is parking behind the restaurant, the first hour and half is for free. It has a cute little wood and brick style inside. The food came pretty quick, and I liked how you could do a combo meal and substitute their buttermilk pancakes for specialty ones. They had a great variety! We had the chocolate divine, sugar and spice, and the cornmeal pancake. All of it was tasty! The pancakes were smaller, the ham was pretty salty, but overall it was great.

This is my favorite spot for my fueling needs the people are super friendly, polite and usually the lowest price for fuel. Its also Liberty gas!! Home of Edward Snowden!! Go get your tank of Liberty!! Go on now!

Wow! All the positive reviews are spot on. Sabrina's is amazing, we started with the stacked ceviche and is was so good, should have taken a pic, but we dove in too quick. Hub ordered the Torta Mexicano and loved it. My Nacho Cubano was delicious, warm and tasty!! Can't wait to come back to sample some more tasty treats.

Great lunch deals on weekdays. I got this lunch combo for $7.50.  A choice of entree, soup, an egg roll, a piece of fruit and  salad.     I don't think any other restaurant can beat this deal. Food and service was good.
So worth the wait! The staff are amazing and so is the food. Perfect place to grab brunch if you're visiting.
Improvement is slow.  Food is same but at least they have a few friendlier people.  I wish they offered some specials.

Absolutely love this restaurant. I sat at the bar and ordered a glass of wine and dinner. The staff was wonderful. High energy and very attentive. I ordered the General Wang with the brown rice. Excellent. Great atmosphere. I will be back with customers. Keep up the great work.

Roger,
Seattle wins AGAIN!!!! You're an awful bartender with awful friends. I keep you in my spank bank, exactly where you belong. Let me know if you need some redecorating, because your front door looks like crap. Drizzle rain? Better grab your umbrella. 

Folks,
If anyone wants soda water in your 'Old Fashioned', this place is for you. Bad people making bad drinks. They would mess up a cup of coffee if you asked for it. It's Folgers btw. I would recommend the trek to Firkins Tavern in Ewing, NJ - the real deal! The further you can get from this trashy, low-class bar, the better.

Went on a Sunday. Very limited menu, much different than what is listed online. If you only serve brunch - let people know! Only one kids option. Food was just okay - we had migas and huevos rancheros. Eggs were over cooked in the huevos rancheros and it came with cilantro on top although that wasn't listed on the menu.

Love Ethiopian food especially the injera bread!   My favorite vegetarian dishes so far are the mushroom dish and cabbage dish.  They give you plenty of injera and if you have leftovers. It lasts about a day more and can be heated slightly in the microwave.

This is pretty much one of my favorite stores in the city and I've found some really great deals recently for gifts and for myself. I don't think I've ever left this place empty-handed! 

Besides enjoying the historic architectural details, I routinely find the staff to be helpful and knowledgeable, whether I'm getting something $ or $$, or just asking questions about something I can only afford to add to my wish-list for now. 

I've only had them gift wrap my purchases a few times and, unlike another reviewer here (perspective dude: First World problems!), I'm a little more forgiving when it comes to a free service. When it's busy (weekends, holiday time, weekends at holiday time) there's going to be a big line, and the people who stay in it are the ones who are going to get their things wrapped before the people who leave it behind for later pick-up. At least, that's what I'd expect if I continue to wait. If you ask, they'll probably just give you paper to wrap it yourself (though, Lord knows it will look like crap if I do it!), or you can go down the street to Papyrus (beautiful wrapping job, but they charge).

This is my favorite restaurant! My husband and I go to Nirvana Indian Bistro every chance we get. We've probably tried the entire menu at this point and it's all fantastic. The owner is the nicest guy and he's very health-conscious, so you never need to feel bad about ordering extra! The staff are all incredibly helpful and attentive. Don't forget to order orange kulfi for dessert!

Being a Missouri girl, I was raised on BBQ. Eli knows how to bbq. It's all about the meat and the smoke. The ribs are my favorite. They are tender, pulling off the bone just right. The chicken, sides and bbq sauce are great but the meat is the KING.

Okay so I have to start this review by saying (1) that the food was actually really good and (2) that this was one of the weirdest experiences of our entire lives.

We came here to use my $30 off birthday certificate and it was also our first time at Benihana.  We'd been to Hibachi before so somewhat knew what to expect but went into it with no expectations.  We sat down with two other couples and immediately knew this was going to be a weird night.  The couple next to us told us that they were regulars and came roughly once/week so we leaned on them for guidance and expertise.  I ordered the Rocky's choice and my husband got the teriyaki steak - both were good but the problem was our experience.  Immediately my water was overfilled and the woman to the other side of the table made a huge deal about it and we knew that they were going to be persnickity and make all of the servers and chefs very flustered and because of that my husband and I just tried to smile, laugh and enjoy our date night and not pay attention to them.  They went on to correct the chef multiple times during his presentation, tell the servers that they were getting them the incorrect sauces, extra dressings, multiple waters and sodas even if they weren't finished with the ones that they had (people, i tried to tell you that this was the weirdest experience we've ever had).  With how shaken the staff was, our presentation was not the best and our food wasn't cooked properly because the chef had to cater to this couples ridiculous demands (more butter, cooked more, i want my vegetables and meat mixed together, cut my meat in the opposite direction).... and then the weirdest part was that the couple ordered an additional steak which when the server went through to ensure that our orders were accurate was never brought up but then when the couple didn't receive it at the end of the meal were OUTRAGED.  To the point where the manager came over and assured them and guaranteed that he put the steak on the plate himself (he didn't) and they called his bluff and everyone got even more uncomfortable.  phew.  Now they forgot my white rice as well as the entire table's ice cream and tea and gave us the incorrect check twice.  The bathroom floors were incredibly sticky and gross and two people at our table had to request new flatware or plates because they weren't cleaned properly.  This review is after a dinner on a Monday night so maybe it was just an off time for this crew and I know that the customers were not helping the cause but we're not willing to try again to find out if it was just a fluke.

Very nice and relaxing atmosphere in each room. The waiting room is comfortable and the staff is very friendly. I had a facial with Daniele today and I would recommend her. She was very knowledgeable and did a very good job. Overall I would recommend this facility!
F*** this place I will never come back here, the people told me to pay before they did my manicure, I mean I know not many black males or males in general come in to get these things done, but dam.

What a fun place to come and walk around.  We were staying in downtown but took at 15 min Uber ride over to check it out.  The decorations for the holidays and great and fun.  This place goes on and on and on. Lots of tour buses and tour groups but it didn't feel to crowded.  This is a money making machine so you'll see bars every 100 ft, gift shops and they have things designed for you to spend.  We took 15 min boat ride which was kinda funny and it let us rest our legs - it was $10.50.  We walked over to the Grand Ole Opry and went by a christmas gift store - again designed to make you spend money, when we got to the Opry - it was $26 for a 45 min tour - we decided that was too much - we would have paid $5 for a peek!!.  This was a great spot to get in some steps, look at the beautiful gardens inside the hotel and check off the bucket list.  We did not stay on site so have no idea what the rooms are like.
This place is dead. We saw too many empty store fronts that we got back in the car and went back home.

We found a cock reach in the bathroom and trash had not been emptied. We asked for other room and they showed us two others, one that had ceiling flakes all over the bathroom counter and floor, and the other with a nasty stench. The lady showing the room said that they flakes were from the room being painted recently and didn't offer to clean it and expected to stay there. Supposedly it is under new management and they're renovating soon but I wouldn't stay there until they do. They would not offer a refund for the one night we had checked in to so we will definitely be calling corporate to complain.

We had great service, the grouper was really good and very fresh.  Wasn't crazy about the potatoes. It's very casual,  you get served on wood seafood plates, hasn't been updated since they took over from last place.  It was an older crowd there. They had  live band on Friday. A little overpriced but good food.  Key west martini was amazing.

This place is pretty small. I got the brisket ramen. The brisket was tender and tasted pretty good. I did not enjoy the Matzo ball in the ramen. The broth was pretty good. It says the brisket ramen would be spicy, but it did not meet my expectations.

Waiter was very  good. Hostess was very pleasant. The quantity of food could be a lot better. I ordered the steak sand and there was only about 3 slices of thin steak meat on roll. There was a lot of roll with very little food inside. For$16.95 , I expect more steak meat. 
Total ripoff!!
Very expensive for the amount of food you get.
I would not go back!

Casa video has been a Tucson icon and in this time of Netflix video shops are not long for this world. Casa Video managed to change their business model to include a trendy craft beer, wine and cider bar. They too have big screens playing awesome movies, wonderful alternative to sports crazed other bars. I love the theme nights, Star Trek, Harry Potter Trivia, game nights. Free popcorn is always a big hit. And you can still rent movies. With a selection that doesn't come close to Netflix, it's totally worth checking out. It's one of my favorite places for good libations and great energy. So glad Casa Video survives!

I have to agree with majority of other Yelpers here - the quality of both the food & customer service are way off. I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap & sweet potato fries & the delivery man practically threw it onto my porch like a newspaper. The flour wrap was stiff & tasted kind of stale & the sweet potato fries were way undercooked. I have had their lasagna before & really liked it so maybe I'll stop in & try that to see if redemption is possible.
This is my favorite breakfast spot in Tucson! Expect to probably wait for a table, but worth every minute! My favorite is the Beni or the Steak & Egg Sandwich. Everything is amazing!

I went to the old Sunset Grille location at sunrise this morning to give Biscuit Love a try. I shared several intimate lunches over the years at Sunset Grille with native Nashvillian, John Siegenthaler. So the location holds special memories for me. I was apprehensive about visiting the "super hip" and "trendy" Biscuit Love for fear of having to stand in line with tourists and hipsters with their beards w/ wool skullcaps that have become the rage in determining local restaurants success. I found neither. 

The place was quiet, the staff super friendly and "loving". Reasonably priced, for Nashville, the food was awesome. The coffee was intense and I am sure sourced "locally". I really enjoyed it. As I sat there thinking about my last lunch with John, I could see that this would have been a place we would have enjoyed together. A win for the locals, the tourists, and the beards! Watch out Pancake Pantry, there is a new breakfast joint in "the Village"!
My first time at Cracker Barrel, and I really liked it. The food was good, and I could not believe how inexpensive it was.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive

To be honest I really struggle with this brewery. I love multiple levels of their establishment, but the beer is not one of them. And let's face it, it's a brewery. Isn't that kind of important? 

Let's start with the heart eyes emoji provoking assets. Their food is great. Their fried chicken sandwich melts in your mouth (I didn't order this but I always get a taste of my buddies palate ). Their bao buns were not the best I've ever had, but still tasty. I actually prefer mine more on the airy, fluffy side, but they choose to sear theirs so it's a little crispy on the outside. I'd also prefer. More crisp than fatty piece of belly inside but hey look who's being contradictory now (make up ya mind, Tone). Anyways, I was surprised at how much I loved the fried rice in my salmon taco. I actually enjoyed a few forkfuls on its own throughout the course. But even still, almost all of the portions are a little small for the price. Quality is important though here, and I feel they nail it. 

The atmosphere is definitely another pro. If you don't like noise, go away. People are having fun and drinking merrily. It's gonna be loud. So talk a little louder, look at your guests when they speak, and laugh at the kids next to you trying to steal their dad's wings. I'm Italian. I'm loud. I love noise. It makes me feel at home. So the tremendously open layout of this building is much preferred over their cafe location. 

So the con here. Guys. Whyyy are your saisons sour? No where else do I experience this, and saisons are my favorites. And guess what.. I hate sours. Don't get me wrong, I've had a few of their beers that I have really enjoyed, but overall I think this place is over hyped. My thought is they just try to get too eccentric, and just get a little nutty with their concoctions. Like I said, I don't hate it, but I rarely love it. I'll still keep going though. The atmosphere, food, and occasional slam dunk brew still reels me in.

The building is beautiful inside and out. The place is First Class with all fresh made,in house dishes. We had a large party but our food came out in a timely manner and was hot. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered and the service was great! We will definitely be back next time we are in Reno!!
Just ate here, with my wife, for the first time. Chilled at the bar, had a beer, and ate some pizza. Great service and good times!
Had some for a building holiday party. Very good food. Meatballs and sweet potato's were delicious

We came here on a Sunday evening around 730 and had 7 people in our party with chicken tender , club sandwich and grilled chicken orders and it took 50 minutes to get our food and it was missing 2 people's side items . While it wasn't the waitress's fault she also didn't attempt to recitify the situation and we saw her a total of 3 times during our wait with one of those being when she took our drink and food order. The manager did take 2 entrees off the Bill but we won't ever be going back .

Visiting SB from the Midwest and after a long day in wine country, our host treated us to carry out Pizza Mizza.  All pies were tasty, but my favorite was the one with chicken, mushroom, and rosemary white sauce.  Not a combination I would have come up with, but they're the creative people.  Yum.

I ordered the steak bowl with some flour tortillas, the meal was okay. The tortillas was small, the bowl will be enough for you to get full for lunch. This spot would be ideal if you want to grab something on the go for lunch but you don't really care how good it taste. The steak itself is thinly cut and little or no seasoning on it. If you dine in they have complimentary tortilla chips but when I was there it wasn't refilled. It can get packed during lunch hours so if you're planning to dine in with more than four people, I suggest you come a bit early to grab some tables. Would I come back? Most likely not, I rather go elsewhere.
